Job ID: A2677491

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product´s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one´s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
Python/R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 26 countries
And more!


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a DATA ANALYST con experiencia mínima de 3 años para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo💥




¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Por qué trabajar aquí?




👉FORMACIÓN PERSONALIZADA: Dispondrás de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars y Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching...

👉MODELO DE TRABAJO HIBRIDO: 1 día oficina (zona Viladecans)

👉PAQUETE DE RETRIBUCIÓN FLEXIBLE: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).

👉SOMOS UNA FAMILIA: Cuidamos de esta gran familia organizando afterworks, cenas y eventos 🍻.




Experiencia:

Desarrollar análisis de datos complejos, aplicando distintas metodologías matemáticas y/o estadísticas para recopilar, organizar, interpretar y resumir datos numéricos para proporcionar información utilizable a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar informes y/o entregables relacionados con datos relevantes para la toma de decisiones, así como sus presentaciones a los equipos de negocio.
Apoyar al equipo de Business Insights en su desarrollo, proporcionando asistencia técnica y entendimiento entre los miembros sobre el uso eficaz de los datos y sus mejores prácticas.
Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos y B.I.).
Ser el focal en las mesas de trabajo con las áreas de negocio para mostrar resultados y avances, siendo capaz de priorizar y planificar el trabajo/proyecto que esté bajo su gestión.
Llevar a cabo investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas y utilizar enfoques de métodos mixtos para el análisis de datos, según necesidades de negocio.




Requisitos:

Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de negocio o analista de datos.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA. Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Alta capacidad analítica y manejo en modelos de datos: sólida experiencia en SQL, Python (deseable) y gestión de Big Data.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con varias áreas y stakeholders.
Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema, imaginar una solución y estructurarla.
Habilidad estructurando la información, analizándola y extrayendo datos según necesidades de negocio.
Se valorará experiencia en herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Inglés Avanzado




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países, por lo que podrás disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura, como en este caso.




💙¡SOMOS UN EXCELENTE LUGAR DE TRABAJO! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Multinacional)
Description:
En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participación en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnologías Microsoft, líderes en el mercado y donde actualmente somos Partners y aportamos más de 490 certificaciones.

Esta es una gran oportunidad para formar parte de una multinacional presente en los 5 continentes como Data Visualization Analyst.

Tu Rol:


Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.
Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información.


Tu perfil:


Profesional con 3 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con distintas areas de negocio.
Orientación a resultados, trabajo colaborativo y en equipo.
Experiencia y solvencia con lenguajes de consulta de datos (p. ej., SQL).
Valorable nivel de inglés alto.


Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:


Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.

Title: Data Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a skilled Data Analytics Analyst to support our data analysis and executive reporting initiatives. This position offers an opportunity to apply your expertise in data analytics while contributing to impactful projects within VTEX. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proven ability to drive insights in a dynamic environment.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure data integrity.
Conduct in-depth quantitative analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain data models and build beautiful dashboards using Power BI and Looker.
Generate comprehensive reports and presentations for internal stakeholders, providing clear and actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuously improve processes and tools to enhance data accuracy and reporting efficiency.


Who You Are


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker and Power BI.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
High attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate work.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
AWS Data Analytics Certification will be considered a plus.
If you have a portfolio, please share the link in your application. It will be considered a plus.


About VTEX

VTEX (NYSE: VTEX), the enterprise digital commerce platform for premier brands and retailers, is the leader in accelerating commerce transformation in Latin America and now expanding globally.

Our platform enables our customers to execute their commerce strategy, including building online stores, integrating and managing orders across channels, and creating marketplaces to sell products from third-party vendors. The VTEX platform is engineered to enterprise-level standards and features. We are trusted by more than 2,000 customers with over 2,500 active online stores across 32 countries, who rely on VTEX to connect with their consumers in a meaningful way. We have been the vendor of choice for numerous Fortune 500 companies in Latin America and are now becoming the global digital commerce vendor for enterprise brands, including Whirlpool, AB InBev, and Motorola.

According to IDC, VTEX is one of five vendors who "shaped the year 2020" and the fastest-growing digital commerce applications vendor in the top 20 market shares.

Benefits


Competitive compensation
Profit-sharing
Flexible work schedule
Possibility to join our equity program
Meal Allowance (Flash)
Transportation assistance
Health, dental, and life insurance
Child Care assistance
Extended parental leaves
Total partnership
Language scholarship: 65% subsidies in English, Spanish, Portuguese courses
Free shipping on 1000+ VTEX stores

  • High attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate work.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
  • AWS Data Analytics Certification will be considered a plus.
  • If you have a portfolio, please share the link in your application. It will be considered a plus.

About VTEX

VTEX (NYSE: VTEX), the enterprise digital commerce platform for premier brands and retailers, is the leader in accelerating commerce transformation in Latin America and now expanding globally.

Our platform enables our customers to execute their commerce strategy, including building online stores, integrating and managing orders across channels, and creating marketplaces to sell products from third-party vendors. The VTEX platform is engineered to enterprise-level standards and features. We are trusted by more than 2,000 customers with over 2,500 active online stores across 32 countries, who rely on VTEX to connect with their consumers in a meaningful way. We have been the vendor of choice for numerous Fortune 500 companies in Latin America and are now becoming the global digital commerce vendor for enterprise brands, including Whirlpool, AB InBev, and Motorola.

According to IDC, VTEX is one of five vendors who "shaped the year 2020" and the fastest-growing digital commerce applications vendor in the top 20 market shares.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation
  • Profit-sharing
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Possibility to join our equity program
  • Meal Allowance (Flash)
  • Transportation assistance
  • Health, dental, and life insurance
  • Child Care assistance
  • Extended parental leaves
  • Total partnership
  • Language scholarship: 65% subsidies in English, Spanish, Portuguese courses
  • Free shipping on 1000+ VTEX stores

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team




Required skills:

At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language







Apply to our offer…

💟 If you are passionate about technologies

💟 If you define yourself as a team worker

💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

💟 If you want to work in an international environment




Our offering:

✨ Permanent contract

✨ Competitive salary

✨ 22 days of vacation

✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas

✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter

✨ Flexible working time

✨ Continuous working days in summer




Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Title: SENIOR DATA ANALYST - DIGITAL DATA
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

Desde el equipo de Digital Data buscamos generar insights que permitan a CaixaBank impulsar la venta digital y la mejora de la experiencia de cliente. Actualmente estamos buscando un Senior Data Analyst que nos ayude a administrar y analizar las diferentes fuentes de información, permitiendo a CaixaBank mejorar la Web/App de CaixaBank mediante un test-and-learn continuado.

Las principales responsabilidades serán:

•    Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares y clientes internos para comprender sus necesidades de datos y proporcionar recomendaciones estratégicas basadas en el análisis de datos.•    Desarrollar análisis cuantitativos y cualitativos para impulsar decisiones y estrategias comerciales y de productos, extrayendo información útil y resolviendo problemas comerciales complejos.•    Utilizar técnicas de análisis avanzadas para analizar conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos, identificando patrones, tendencias y correlaciones.•    Realizar análisis de impacto en cambios de Producto / App, con visión integral desde conversión hasta impacto en métricas de Negocio•    Garantizar el cumplimiento, la gobernanza y la calidad de los datos.•    Limpiar y preprocesar datos para garantizar su integridad y facilidad de uso con fines de análisis y modelado.

 

Descripción del perfil: Requerimientos mínimos

 

Licenciatura o máster en un grado STEM (ingeniería, estadística, matemáticas, física, …)
Más de 5 años de experiencia laboral relevante como analista de datos, data scientist o puesto similar.
Fuertes habilidades para resolver problemas, con capacidad de pensamiento analítico y crítico.
Orientación a impacto en Negocio y Experiencia Cliente.
Excelentes dotes de comunicación y presentación, con capacidad para explicar conceptos complejos de forma clara y concisa.
Gran dominio de SQL y experiencia en la preparación, consolidación y normalización de datos.
Dominio de herramientas de analítica web (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Amplitude, …)
Competencias clave

 

Demostrada capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas. 
Flexibilidad para trabajar con autonomía con calendarios ajustados.  
Orientación al detalle y con capacidad de priorización y coordinación de varios proyectos.
Actitud proactiva y capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de forma transversal. 
Resiliencia y capacidad de adaptación a entornos cambiantes y de alta criticidad. 
Comunicación en español e inglés hablado y escrito 
Ofrecemos: ¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

Formar parte del “Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021” según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continuo. 
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicado a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros. 
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist Júnior en Modelos de Innovación de Riesgos
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Más de 14.000 personas que trabajamos en equipo compartiendo nuestro esfuerzo para alcanzar una meta. Nos caracterizamos por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Somos una entidad que en su larga y exitosa trayectoria ha sabido combinar la tradición en la forma de hacer banca, la visión a largo plazo, el crecimiento y la innovación. Una marca fuerte y reconocida en el entorno, para más de 11 millones de clientes que valoran la calidad de nuestros productos y nuestra apuesta por gestionar “su experiencia” como cliente.

Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.

Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.

¡Únete a nosotros!




¿Qué estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo, con visión de negocio y habilidades interpersonales que se integre en un equipo que analiza la adecuación de diversos modelos de riesgo crediticio asociados al segmento de negocio de Banca Particulares de Banco Sabadell.




Hablemos del proyecto...




Tu misión se centrará en dar soporte a la medición y anticipación del comportamiento del cliente, mediante el desarrollo de metodologías analíticas avanzadas, que ayuden a predecir y entender cómo es, qué hace, cómo será y qué hará el cliente, repercutiendo en acciones que simplifiquen los procesos de admisión, seguimiento y recuperación, incrementando su eficiencia – eficacia y ayudando a generar el margen incremental creciente de Sabadell España.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:




Colaborarás en el desarrollo de modelos enfocados a potenciar la creación de negocio mediante metodologías analíticas y de Machine Learning.
Desarrollarás hipótesis que permitan diseñar y probar experimentos analíticos, con el objetivo de identificar áreas de oportunidad y medir el impacto potencial de nuevas iniciativas.
Elaborarás la documentación de modelos requerida para su presentación a comités.
Participarás en diversos proyectos de la Dirección que afecten a los modelos tanto para la creación de negocio como para anticipar el comportamiento de los clientes.
Revisarás y mejorarás los modelos actuales en función de las directrices de cumplimento normativo interno y externo exigido por los reguladores.




¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en ámbito Técnico (Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física o similar) empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar).
Master o Postgrado en Finanzas Cuantitativas o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en creación y mantenimiento de modelos de riesgo crediticio en sector Banca.
Que estés habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gestión de información, análisis de BBDD y elaboración de informes.
Valoraremos experiencia en creación de modelos estadísticos con diferentes metodologías.
Que conozcas lenguajes de programación estadística (SAS-SQL, R, Phyton), así como dominio del paquete Office.
Valoraremos que aportes un correcto nivel de Inglés (sobre todo a nivel de comprensión).




Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.




Queda totalmente prohibida la reproducción total o parcial de cualquiera de sus apartados en cualquier soporte sin el consentimiento por escrito del Grupo Banco Sabadell.

Show more

Title: Jr Finance Data Analyst – Based in Barcelona
Description:
Company Description

Kaplan Language Group (KLG) is a reliable and respected leader in the language travel industry, that provides high-quality, language-travel programs across the world. The group consists of some of the biggest names in educational language tourism: Alpadia Language Schools, ESL Languages, and Kaplan International Languages. With more than 130 combined years of experience and thousands of happy and satisfied alumni – KLG is a reliable and respected leader in the language travel industry.

KLG offers a wide range of language and cultural programs in more than 100 countries across the world, allowing students to embark on a unique, life-changing journey specifically tailored to them.

, Job Description

Position Summary

This is a position for the Reporting team that is integrated into the KLG FP&A team. Our goal is to give support to our main stakeholders by creating impactful power BI reports and giving analysis that would help and would have a direct impact on business profitability.

Main Responsibilities And Functions

The person in this Data Analyst role will be involved in


Day-to-day modeling, design, and development with Power BI.
You will provide commercial support to Finance and Operations teams (sales and customer care)
Translating business requirements into functional specifications, data source requirements, data extraction and data transformation
Assist in managing projects
Collect and manage a backlog of requirements, to allow the team to deliver business value in every sprint
Work closely with the report owners to test and evaluate the results of your reports


, Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Business administration or Finance
Creative and adaptive mindset
At least 1-3 years of experience in Finance (FP&A, controlling, Finance Businnes Partner)
Experience in BI & analytics projects is desirable.
Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services would be a plus
Advanced level of Excel is a must.
Good command of written and spoken English.


Additional Information


What We Offer You:
The opportunity to develop your skills in an international environment, in the exciting field of language travel
Flexible working policy
A young and dynamic work atmosphere
An environment where corporate ethics and sustainable development matter
Competitive salary
Lunch vouchers
Free coffee and tea
Free breakfast on Mondays and fresh fruit on Thursdays
Language courses abroad
Medical insurance benefits discounts


Place of work: Barcelona (ES)

Start date: ASAP

Reference: KLG_MKT

Type of contract:Permanent contract with 6 months trial period

Activity rate: Full time

Title: Data Analyst Freelance en Barcelona
Description:
En HAYS estamos colaborando con una compañía especializada en el desarrollo y producción de Masterbatch de Color y Aditivos para el refinado de plásticos. El grupo surge de la fusión en la misma casa de marcas de: Galloplast, NCA y Vanoplast, que son marcas complementarias, muy bien posicionadas en el mercado de Masterbatch y aditivos. Esta unificación es una excelente oportunidad para mostrar la profundidad, amplitud y potencia de todas nuestras marcas, ofrecer productos de alto valor añadido, una amplia gama de servicios y soluciones, última tecnología en maquinaria de dispersión de color y alta capacidad de industrialización de cara a proyectos de gran magnitud y complejidad. La compañía tiene su sede en Barcelona (España) y otras plantas de producción en Pamplona (España) y Aviñón (Francia), oficinas de ventas y agentes en toda Europa y el norte de África, lo que le permite responder con rapidez y flexibilidad a las solicitudes de los clientes.




Actualmente estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst Freelance para dar soporte en un proyecto de implementación de ERP interno.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Gestión y Recopilar, procesar y analizar datos relevantes para diversas áreas del negocio del cliente.
Generar informes y dashboards que proporcionen insights accionables para la toma de decisiones.
Colaborar con el departamento financiero y de operaciones del cliente para identificar necesidades y oportunidades de mejora a través del análisis de datos.
Participar en la planificación, ejecución y seguimiento de proyectos de digitalización del cliente.
Implementar soluciones tecnológicas que mejoren la eficiencia operativa y la calidad del servicio.
Documentar procesos y procedimientos digitales para asegurar su correcta aplicación y continuidad.
Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener aplicaciones y herramientas de software internas para el cliente.
Garantizar que las herramientas desarrolladas se alineen con los objetivos del negocio y las necesidades de los usuarios finales del cliente.
Realizar pruebas de funcionalidad y asegurar la calidad del software antes de su implementación.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los departamentos financiero y de operaciones del cliente para entender sus necesidades y desarrollar soluciones tecnológicas adecuadas.
Proporcionar soporte técnico y formación a los usuarios finales sobre las herramientas desarrolladas.
Facilitar la comunicación y coordinación entre los equipos del cliente y la empresa subcontratante para asegurar la alineación de objetivos y prioridades.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos?

Perfil en Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Ingeniería industrial o un campo relacionado.
Experiencia en tecnologías de bases de datos (SQL), Excel avanzado (DAX, conexiones a BBDD, VBA) y herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI).
Experiencia con el proceso ETL.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos, proyectos de digitalización.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Proyecto estable como Freelance.
Modalidad de trabajo: al principio se iría a oficina por formaciones y después más flexible en cuanto al remoto.
Ubicación: Vacarisses, Barcelona.
40 hrs/semanales flexible.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kia Ora, Hola, สวัสดี, Guten Tag!

WhereTo is a business travel startup from San Francisco that evolved into an agile development and design studio within the Flight Centre family. We build travel solutions used by some of the largest companies on the planet - we have just one goal: making business travel better for everybody.

WhereTo provides an AI-powered travel platform for corporate travel. Their platform uses machine learning algorithms to recommend personalized travel options based on a traveler's preferences, company policies, and budget. WhereTo's technology also allows for real-time travel tracking, reporting, and cost analysis, enabling companies to optimize their travel programs and reduce costs.

To learn more about WhereTo click HERE

About Your Opportunity

If you love data, this job is for you. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to take on the role of Level II Data Analyst. As a Level II Data Analyst, you will be responsible for advanced data analysis, development of complex reports and dashboards, and providing strategic insights to drive operational performance for our global business. This position requires expertise in data transformation, modeling, and reporting development. Join our fast-paced environment at WhereTo as a Level II Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of travel through data analysis and innovation.

A day in the life


Develop advanced visual reports, interactive dashboards, and KPI scorecards to provide in-depth insights into operational performance.
Collect and process vast amounts of data from multiple sources, employing advanced data transformation techniques to ensure usability and accuracy.
Generate ad hoc reports, complex datasets, and leverage database or data warehouse queries and scripts to extract information for end-users.
Integrate data from diverse sources and systems to produce comprehensive and requested data elements.
Conduct ad hoc analysis of business data, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies to support decision-making.
Provide assistance and support to customers, addressing data integrity, validation questions, and resolving related queries.
Analyze data and trends and propose performance improvement measures to optimize operational efficiency.
Collaborate effectively with operations and engineering teams, participating in issue identification, estimation, prioritization, and resolution.
Comfortably operate within the Agile Scrum model, actively contributing to team meetings and sprint planning sessions.
Attend meetings with clients and stakeholders, presenting findings, insights, and recommendations with clarity and professionalism.



Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics) or related experience.
Strong communication skills required.
Strong experience working with analytics platforms such as mixpanel or similar required.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Superset, Tableau, etc
Experience with data analytics databases such as Druid.
Demonstrate a deep understanding of data relationships and a mastery of SQL syntax to perform advanced data retrieval and manipulation.
Exhibit exceptional analysis and design skills, critical thinking, and problemsolving abilities to tackle complex business challenges.
Experience in the DAX language, enabling the development of complex calculations and measures within Power BI a plus.
Prior experience working with travel data, understanding the unique challenges and requirements within the industry a plus.
Proficiency in Python or R, enabling advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning capabilities a plus.



Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.


Our fantastic offices are located in the heart of Barcelona, at Plaça Catalunya.
The opportunity to join our free language lessons (English, French, Spanish or Catalan).
An attractive package: health insurance
25 days off/year + 5 compensation days + reduced time during summer + bank holidays.
Flexible working-time.
Table tennis on the terrace, a kitchen area with free snacks, fresh fruits and drinks.
The opportunity to work with an international and talented team.
Several activities organised by the ambassadors!


#WT

#WTO

Title: Data Analyst con Tableau - 90% remoto
Description:
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Data Analyst en una en una empresa líder del sector aeronautico en un entorno colaborativo jerarquía plana y con proyección laboral??

Tu misión será dar sentido a los datos y transformarlos en información útil para la toma de decisiones de las áreas de negocio así como entender las necesidades del cliente interno y liderar dentro de su equipo de trabajo la creación de reportes y herramientas que mejor apoyen y ayuden en la visualización de la información.

¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?


Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas tableros gráficos de información mapeo herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones) para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.
Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información teniendo una mirada crítica e impulsando las mejores prácticas del uso y consumo de datos.
Velar por el cumplimiento de los estándares de trabajo procesos y correcta utilización de herramientas definidos desde el equipo de central de Business Insights para asegurar procesos eficientes y escalables.


Para ello ¿qué vas a necesitar?


Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando Tableau.
Nivel avanzado de Excel y con experiencia en manejo de bases de datos (Access SQL Server ...)
Formación superior en negocios matemáticas económicas finanzas estadística o ingeniería. Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?


Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.
Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (entre 35.000 - 48.000 euros brutos anuales).
Horario flexible de lunes a jueves viernes intensivo así como en verano y visperas de festivos
Modelo híbrido (4 días remoto- 1 día en oficina)
Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.
Seguro médico privado.
Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico restaurante transporte guardería y formación.
Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.


¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

tableau, excel, acces, SQL

Title: Global Data Analyst
Description:
Who We are

Our mission is to “make the healthcare experience more human”. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of €130 million to date.

“Culture eats strategy for breakfast” according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We’re looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.



Job Description



Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive:

3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
A good excellent understanding of SQL
An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
You have some experience in Machine Learning


Additional Information



Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with Aïnhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & José Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, José and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
Gym membership (reduced price)
Health Insurance paid by the company
Flexible retribution plan benefits
Mental health program (iFeel)
23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ❤️

Title: Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge And Skills


Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP’s own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated activities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let’s have a talk!

Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities

  • Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
  • Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
  • Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
  • Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
  • Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
  • Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
  • Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
  • Optimization and standardization
  • Identify improvement opportunities

Education & Experience Recommended

  • Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
  • Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.

Sales and Services Entity (ES11)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Marketing Data Analyst into our Analytics team.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Zynga and Socialpoint.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the Marketing and user Acquisition teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Ensure the data that senior stakeholders use to support key decisions is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics


Requirements


2-3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g statistics, math, computer science or similar). Master’s degree in a relevant field will also be valued.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL and databases.
Basic Python skills for data analysis and automation tasks.
Experience using data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker…)
Excellent communication skills, know how to work in a team, prioritize and manage your own workload.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently


Nice-to-haves


Experience in a mobile B2C business.
Experience implementing data science models with Python.
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analyzing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!


Benefits

Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Network Engineer in Barcelona. Start your new adventure in an international and agile Environment by identifying opportunities for improvement at the technical, functional, and organizational levels.




Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With a tailor-made career path, develop your skills and work on challenging projects for one of our more than 1000 clients across the globe. Being 6,350 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries you will feel part of our talented and international community. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information Systems & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences, and Engineering.




We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is in step with you to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.







👉WHAT WILL YOU DO? 👈

·      Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities

·      Prioritize needs coming from stakeholders

·      Perform functional research and design to determine possible solutions

·      Construct ad-hoc financial models and analyses to support deliverables

·      Perform functional testing and user acceptance testing

·      Conduct data discovery and profiling for fit and gap analysis

·      Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty

·      Actively contribute to team ceremonies including: sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives

·      Demonstrate a strong ownership in understanding business needs and driving business valued outcome

·      Communicate on outcomes to stakeholders to ensure understanding of progress and potential roadblocks.







👉WHAT DO WE NEED? 👈




·      University degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent

·      5+ years of accounting or finance experience

·      2+ years of hands on experience with SAP ECC or S/4

·      Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel

·      Comfortable writing SQL queries

·      Passionate about learning everyday

·      Customer satisfaction & Business oriented

·      Strong communication skills

·      Experience with PySpark

·      Fluent in English




Preferred qualifications:

·      Experience with AWS

·      Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)







🚀WHY US? 🚀




We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve ourselves to the best. Working next to super-talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of our colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, and that’s why we can offer:




Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of €565M and over 1,000 clients across the world

Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people from over 60 countries and 5 continents, being able to benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors.

Flexibility is the order of the day, so we have friendly remote policies, an intensive workday, as well as social benefits such as Transit, Restaurant or Kindergarten ticket, and Private Health Insurance

Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path and salary evaluation: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level

Develop your skills with our Tech Academy catalogue in last technologies, access the Udemy E-learning Platform with over 500 training courses, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, and project management, and participate in our Webinars and Workshops.

Choose your own training course with your annual personal budget and take advantage of our partners getting certifications paid for by the company.

Feel part of our Community by being part of our Languages sessions, Team buildings, Afterword hangouts, and the Event of the Year.

We have the We Care program, where the company aid critically affected employees.

Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/jobs




Equal Opportunity⚖️:




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst (SAP BW)
Description:
Your new role:




Development of data models and transformations in SAP BW to fulfill reporting requirements
Development and monitoring of SAP BW loading jobs
Development of Reports with AfO and SAC based on SAP BW data models
Development of CDS Views in Source Systems (S/4 Retail) as Datasoure
Development of Views in GCP BigQuery as Datasource for SAP BW
SAC Administration Tasks
Development of SAC Dashboards




Requirements:




Experience with SAP BI platforms and very good technology knowledge in SAP BW on HANA, HANA Native, SAP BO, SAP BI-IP, SAP Analytics Cloud
Experience in an engineering / technology role, ideally in agile product environments / teams
Experience working in agile product teams, DevOps methods and continuous delivery with a focus on optimizing customer benefits
Very good written and spoken English skills, German is an advantage
Willingness to be on call on occasional weekends




What we offer:




Permanent contract directly with the end client
Young and dynamic environment
10% discount on the brand
Language classes
Training budget
Career plan
Intensive work schedule every Friday throughout the year and during the summer months
Competitive salary
Hybrid mode (1 day in-person/week)

Title: ESG Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About The Organization

Sun Chemical, a member of the DIC Group, is a leading producer of packaging and graphic solutions, color and display technologies, functional products, electronic materials, and products for the automotive and healthcare industries. Together with DIC, Sun Chemical is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations and better the world around us. With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.

Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Coöperatief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter

THE ROLE

As an ESG Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate reporting of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) data. Your responsibilities will include:



Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting ESG data to meet regulatory requirements and support our sustainability goals
Ensuring compliance with regulatory developments and reporting requirements (e.g., CSRD, EU Taxonomy Regulation)
Evolve a reporting tool that integrates all aspects of ESG reporting
Collaborate with global cross-functional teams (HR, Procurement, Corporate EHS, Operations, and Business Teams) for effective communication of ESG data
Ensure key personnel across the company understand their responsibilities related to ESG reporting
Monitor industry and regulatory developments to stay informed about ESG standards



YOUR PROFILE



Relevant degree in sustainability, environmental sciences, biology, chemistry, or engineering
Working experience in sustainability-related functions, ideally with interpretation of data
Strong interest in Environmental, Social and Governance issues
Previous experience or coursework related materiality assessments is a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
Willingness to work with databases is a must, knowledge of data collection tools is a plus
Excellent research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to develop own ideas and implement approaches alone and in a team
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Fluency in English is mandatory, any additional language is a plus



Benefits

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.

If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can bring value to the role, we’d love to learn more about you. Do you have any questions regarding the application process? Please feel free to get in touch with us. You can contact our recruiting team at: sun-careers@sunchemical.com

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

It is Sun’s policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.

YOUR PROFILE


  • Relevant degree in sustainability, environmental sciences, biology, chemistry, or engineering
  • Working experience in sustainability-related functions, ideally with interpretation of data
  • Strong interest in Environmental, Social and Governance issues
  • Previous experience or coursework related materiality assessments is a plus
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
  • Willingness to work with databases is a must, knowledge of data collection tools is a plus
  • Excellent research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to develop own ideas and implement approaches alone and in a team
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
  • Fluency in English is mandatory, any additional language is a plus


Benefits

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.

If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can bring value to the role, we’d love to learn more about you. Do you have any questions regarding the application process? Please feel free to get in touch with us. You can contact our recruiting team at: sun-careers@sunchemical.com

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

It is Sun’s policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.

Title: Analista de datos
Company: Germans Trias i Pujol Research Institute (IGTP)
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

IGTP Childhood Liver Oncology Group is looking highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team focused on childhood liver cancer research. You will play a crucial role in managing and analyzing data related to patients and biological samples. This data will be instrumental in advancing our understanding of the disease and developing new treatment strategies.




QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCIE:
Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Bioinformatics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Strong experience with data analysis tools and methodologies, including Power BI, RStudio and SAS.
Experience in creating data models and handling databases
Experience with data cleaning, validation, and management best practices.
Knowledge in advanced R and Python languages.
Proven ability to generate clear and informative data visualizations.
Languages: Spanish, English and Catalan (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Clean, validate, and manage large datasets using Power BI and potentially other relevant data analysis tools
Generate data visualizations and reports that effectively communicate research findings to scientists and stakeholders.
Collaborate with researchers to ensure data integrity and meet project timelines.
Maintain data security and compliance with relevant regulations.
May participate writing activities and contribute to research publications.




WHAT WE OFFER:
Full-time contract (law of science).
Date of incorporation: September 2024
Gross annual remuneration inherent to the square objected to this call, will be fixed based on the experience provided and the skills of the candidate, distributed in 12 payments.
Possibility of working from home two days per week.
Flexible payment (childminding vouchers).
23 days holiday and 5 days for personal matters.
Training capsules by the company.
Be part of an excellent multidisciplinary research centre with the HRS4R badge.
Location on the Can Ruti Campus, a first-class translational research environment in the Barcelona area, in a very stimulating scientific environment. The IGTP offers a supportive, friendly and collaborative ecosystem to promote professional development and help you achieve your research goals.




FOR MORE INFORMATION:

Check our website: www.germanstrias.org/ca/research/cancer/2/oncologia-hepatica-infantil-c-log.

Other project websites: www.pmed4hb.eu/

﻿

HOW TO APPLY:
Interested persons should send a cover letter explaining their interest in the position, their CV and contact details of 2-3 references by email to seleccio@igtp.cat.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
En Cleverals estamos buscando al mejor Marketing Data Analyst. Serás una parte relevante de nuestra estrategia a futuro.




Estamos redefiniendo la forma de conseguir oportunidades de negocio en el sector de lead generation; ayudando a los potenciales clientes a tomar decisiones de compra y conectándoles con las marcas más relevantes del mercado tecnológico en diferentes países. Súmate a una empresa tecnológica que ha experimentado un 720% de crecimiento en los últimos 3 años.




Sobre el rol:

Buscamos una persona que impulse la captación de nuevas oportunidades de negocio a través de los datos, identificando mejoras en nuestras campañas, nuevas oportunidades y dando soluciones a retos de negocio del resto de equipos mediante análisis de datos: optimizar campañas de marketing, rentabilidad de campañas, calidad de los resultados…




Serás el punto de contacto en datos, automatizaciones y optimizaciones de campaña. Tu trabajo principal será ofrecer soluciones a marketing y ventas para mejorar el volumen y calidad de las oportunidades de negocio captadas para nuestros clientes.




Principales responsabilidades:

Identificar mejoras a través del análisis de datos para

Maximizar la rentabilidad, volumen y calidad de los resultados en la captación de leads
Lanzar nuevas campañas / productos en sectores existentes y nuevos
Realizar análisis de mercado para identificar áreas de crecimiento (en nuevos productos o existentes)

Apoyar al equipo de paid media en la configuración y optimización diarias.

Realizar investigaciones de palabras clave para optimización en campañas SEM
Colaborar en el desarrollo de la estrategia SEM
Determinar el mix de canales para llegar a objetivos 

Ser el punto de contacto con marketing, tech y ventas

Verificar su alineamiento con la estrategia
Proporcionarles insights a partir de los datos

Generar informes de rendimiento:

PowerBI, Excel (tablas dinámicas, VLOOKUPs, etc.), Zoho Analytics… para extraer insights.

Generar forecasting de:

volúmenes de leads, costes y resultados esperables.

Apoyar las operaciones de marketing: 

Garantizar que todos los datos fluyen desde diferentes fuentes (formularios, analítica, SEM…) al CRM 

Determinar KPIs objetivos:

Monitorizarlos y aportar recomendaciones.

Administrar y automatizar nuestra plataforma: 

Desarrollar mejoras en la plataforma como integraciones (make.com, zapier), APIs, creación y conexión de formularios, workflows, campos, lead scoring…




Habilidades necesarias:

100% enfoque en datos
Experiencia en marketing o ventas
Muy estructurado
Conocimiento profundo de matemáticas y estadística
Conocimientos de ventas / negocio
Capacidad de identificar grandes oportunidades y riesgos potenciales
Habilidad de resolver problemas con lógica
Saber comunicarse con las personas.




Requisitos:

Idioma: español e Inglés nivel B2. 
Nivel de educación mínimo: bachillerato.
Residencia en Barcelona.




Habilidades valorables:

+2 años en análisis de datos
Excel avanzado
Análisis de marketing y ventas: optimización de funnels, de campañas SEM...
Consultas SQL avanzadas
Crear informes, dashboards




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato de trabajo a tiempo indefinido.
Banda salarial: Entre 32 y 38 mil euros brutos anuales. 
Bonus Trimestrales: Sujeto al cumplimiento de objetivos empresariales.
Lugar de trabajo: Barcelona, cerca de la zona de Sarria/Les Corts.




Nuestros beneficios:

Kit de bienvenida.
Viernes jornada de trabajo corta (hasta las 14:00). Tarde libre los viernes.
Jornada intensiva en verano.
Posibilidad de trabajo en remoto los viernes.
Día libre la semana del cumpleaños.
Desayuno gratis todos los lunes.
Vacaciones competitivas: 22 días al año de vacaciones pagadas.
Días festivos nacionales y de la comunidad de Catalunya.
Horario de entrada y salida flexible.
Día Cleverals: 25 enero.




¿Por qué Cleverals? 

Tendrás un rol influyente y verás el impacto de tus acciones.
Trabajarás en proyectos que aportarán valor a tu carrera profesional.
Estarás rodeado de especialistas que han conseguido un 720% de expansión.




Nuestros valores:

Clever Driver: Nos comprometemos y somos resolutivos.
Clever Perfectionist: Superamos la calidad esperada.
Clever Explorer: Exploramos y optimizamos continuamente nuestras prácticas.
Clever Colleague: Avanzamos coordinados para conseguir mayor impacto.
Clever Mood: Dominamos los desafíos que nos proponemos.

 

Si crees que la posición encaja con tu perfil y cumples con los requisitos indicados, ¡INSCRÍBETE AHORA! Envíanos tu CV actualizado y una carta de presentación. Estamos deseando conocerte.




En Cleverals, estamos orgullosos de ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y nos comprometemos a crear un lugar de trabajo diverso e integrador. Por lo que esta oferta está dirigida a cualquier persona que reúna los requisitos exigidos, independientemente de su condición.




La protección de su privacidad y la seguridad de sus datos es una de las principales prioridades de Cleverals. Consulte nuestra Política de Privacidad (https://www.cleverals.com/es/privacidad/) para saber cómo trataremos los datos personales que nos proporcione.

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
