Title: Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data Analyst. You will be working together with other data analysts and data scientists focused on creating a holistic understanding of user journeys, life cycle management and user acquisition through online performance marketing and other media. As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets. Thus, covering the full scope from data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to evangelize the usage of data via dashboards and/or other means of visualizations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:
Work closely with other team members, data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust and relevant.
Work closely with other team members to ensure they have easy access to reliable and relevant data in their work optimizing channels and campaigns by delivering self-service data though dashboards.
Perform on-demand quantitative analysis and reports to inform growth and/or operational strategy.
Execute and evangelize actionable insights within the team to optimise growth marketing.
Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.
To do this successfully we believe you are:
Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams and Product Madness as a whole.
Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.
Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.


Requirements

What We're Looking For
2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Preferred experience with ETL and data engineering processes
Fluent in English


Meriting Skills
A masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a similar discipline
Experience with Python and/or R
Experience with building and tweaking attribution models
Experience with regression modelling and statistical analysis
Experience with setting up and analyzing A/B-tests
Experience from working with other F2P games, social casino titles or RMG or general knowledge about the mobile games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses.
Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry


Why Product Madness?

You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United.

Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel.

You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.

So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations
Show more
HTML:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data Analyst. You will be working together with other data analysts and data scientists focused on creating a holistic understanding of user journeys, life cycle management and user acquisition through online performance marketing and other media. As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets. Thus, covering the full scope from data mining to reporting. In addition you will also be responsible to evangelize the usage of data via dashboards and/or other means of visualizations to key stakeholders throughout the company.

What You'll Do

Why this role?

This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:
  • Work closely with other team members, data engineers and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust and relevant.
  • Work closely with other team members to ensure they have easy access to reliable and relevant data in their work optimizing channels and campaigns by delivering self-service data though dashboards.
  • Perform on-demand quantitative analysis and reports to inform growth and/or operational strategy.
  • Execute and evangelize actionable insights within the team to optimise growth marketing.
  • Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.
To do this successfully we believe you are:
  • Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams and Product Madness as a whole.
  • Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.
  • Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.

Requirements

What We're Looking For
  • 2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Preferred experience with ETL and data engineering processes
  • Fluent in English

Meriting Skills
  • A masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a similar discipline
  • Experience with Python and/or R
  • Experience with building and tweaking attribution models
  • Experience with regression modelling and statistical analysis
  • Experience with setting up and analyzing A/B-tests
  • Experience from working with other F2P games, social casino titles or RMG or general knowledge about the mobile games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses.
  • Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry

Why Product Madness?

You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United.

Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel.

You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.

So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness?

Our Values
  • People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
  • MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
  • Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
  • Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
  • Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

Title: Data Engineer Junior
Description:
En KENOS Technology, estamos comprometidos/as a ser tu aliado principal en el desarrollo de tu carrera profesional. Te ofrecemos proyectos donde serás el/la protagonista, con formación práctica diseñada para impulsar tus expectativas profesionales en el apasionante mundo del Data Engineering.

Aprenderás a:


Desarrollar habilidades en la manipulación y procesamiento de datos utilizando Python y SQL.
Diseñar, construir y mantener pipelines de datos eficientes y escalables.
Apoyar el crecimiento del equipo proporcionando asistencia técnica y fomentando el uso eficaz de los datos.
Crear y optimizar bases de datos y sistemas de almacenamiento de datos.
Colaborar estrechamente con distintas áreas para identificar oportunidades y riesgos.


Requisitos:


Formación académica en informática, ingeniería, matemáticas, estadística o áreas relacionadas.
Experiencia mínima en Python, SQL y herramientas de manejo de datos.


¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?﻿


Contrato Indefinido desde el primer día.
Posición híbrida en Barcelona.
Formación remunerada de 2 meses en el área de datos.
Incorporación a proyecto pasados los 2 meses de formación.
Plan de carrera profesional y de remuneración.
Jornada intensiva los viernes y en los meses de julio y agosto.
Salario flexible, con ticket restaurant, ticket guardería, ticket transporte, seguro médico.


¡Únete a nuestro equipo y comienza a construir tu futuro hoy mismo!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Europe)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.



Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?

Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?

Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?

Let’s talk money

Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

A 30-minute meeting with Sally Hütter - Talent Acquisition Partner for International Teams
A 45-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (45 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Consultant Data & Analytics
Description:
Ubicación:

Barcelona L'Hospitalet de Llob, ES, 08908

Fecha: 5 jul. 2024

¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.

Desde el equipo de LIGHTHOUSE, nuestra área de Data & Analytics, ayudamos a nuestros clientes a encontrar la eficiencia y el alto rendimiento en todas sus funciones TIC, tanto internas como externas hacia sus unidades de negocio y proveedores: buscando la máxima eficiencia en la operación de sus servicios y ajustando sus costes; así como incrementando su trascendencia en la cuenta de resultados y facilitando la innovación.

Actualmente, nos encontramos en proceso de crecimiento y estamos buscando un Consultant Data & Analytics para incorporarse al equipo

¿Qué podrías hacer?


Modelos de datos tanto a nivel diseño como a nivel análisis
Reporting de datos (PowerBI, Qlik, etc)
Bases de datos SQL y NoSQ (importante agilidad en consultas)
Programación con diferentes lenguajes, tales como Python


¿Que necesitas saber?


Experiencia entre 1 - 3 años en las funciones descritas anteriormente.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos relacionados con analítica de datos


Valorable:


Conocimiento y experiencia en entornos cloud


¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?


Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas


Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers’ behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!


Benefits

Coming to work in the Brand new office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
Breakfast and lunch for free and also amazing coffee from our barista


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.
Show more

  • Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
  • A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.

What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?

  • Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
  • Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
  • An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
  • 5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
  • A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
  • Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
  • Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
  • Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
  • Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
  • Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
  • Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!

Benefits

Coming to work in the Brand new office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

  • Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
  • A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
  • Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
  • Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
  • Breakfast and lunch for free and also amazing coffee from our barista

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Somos DDB, somos creadores de ideas.

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser líderes.

Trabajamos con ellos como socios estratégicos.

Nos sumergimos en el negocio de nuestros clientes y buscamos soluciones creativas.

Iniciamos y mantenemos vivo el diálogo de las marcas con el consumidor.

Creamos ideas con trascendencia social porque sólo así tendremos relevancia.

Perfil

En DDB buscamos un/a Data Analyst para que forme parte de nuestro equipo en la oficina de Barcelona.

Responsabilidades


Exploración de datos y creación de informes
Análisis web y entorno digital
Visualización de datos y dashboards en:
Adobe Analytics
Google Analytics y Data Studio
Otros
Estudios de consumidores, comportamiento digital, journey de usuarios, navegación y usabilidad
Segmentación y perfilado de usuarios/consumidores
Búsqueda de data para obtención de insights y generación de recomendaciones
Marketing digital para industria automoción

Requisitos


Performance de campañas Paid (especialmente SEM/Display/Programática)
Análisis de performance en social media.
Estrategia SEO
Set up/mantenimiento de Google Tag Manager
Modelos de atribución y fases de funnel
CRM
Definición de KPIs y métricas relevantes
Conocimiento entornos digitales, especialmente web
Orientación a obtención de insights estratégicos
Habilidades de presentación y comunicación


Todas las candidaturas serán consideradas para el empleo, independientemente de su raza, orientación sexual o edad.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Modelo de trabajo híbrido: días presenciales en la oficina combinados con días de teletrabajo.

Ambiente de trabajo creativo y dinámico donde podrás desarrollar todo tu talento y podrás crecer personal y profesionalmente.

Nuestro programa DDB Concilia, con beneficios exclusivos por pertenecer a DDB, además de programas de bienestar emocional con servicios personalizados.

Todo esto y mucho más. ¿Te vienes?

Tu información personal se utilizará de acuerdo con nuestro Aviso de Privacidad. Puedes leer nuestro Aviso de Privacidad aquí cuando presentes tu solicitud.

Title: Prácticas de Análisis de Datos
Description:
Desde Grupo Planeta, estamos buscando incorporar un/a estudiante en prácticas que quiera formar parte de uno de nuestros equipos de Data Analysis del Departamento de Student Intelligence, de la División de Formación del Grupo Planeta. (ESD Design)

Job Description:

Bajo la supervisión del Student Service Intelligence y en coordinación con el resto del equipo participarás en las siguientes tareas:


Actualización y mejora de Dashboards
Soporte y apoyo al Departamento en la obtención de datos y en asentar BBDD
Ayuda en la construcción de informes y análisis de KPIs
Aplicación de metodologías y uso de herramientas que permitan profundizar en el comportamiento del alumnado.



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Trabajar en una empresa consolidada en el sector con oportunidades de crecimiento personal y desarrollo profesional.
Aprenderás día a día en un equipo dinámico, profesional y experto en la materia.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?


Estudios universitarios o de posgrado en el campo cuantitativo (Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, etc.)
Idiomas: castellano y valorable inglés
Posibilidad de firmar convenio con tu universidad o escuela por un mínimo de 6 meses.
Posibilidad de realizar prácticas de 9h a 15h, de lunes a viernes.
Conocimientos de Excel. Valorable de manera muy positiva conocimiento en VBA.
Conocimiento básico de PowerBI, lenguaje DAX, lenguaje M.
Disponibilidad inmediata.
Valorable:
Conocimiento básico del lenguaje programación SQL.
Conocimiento básico del lenguaje programación Python.



¿Cómo nos gustaría que fueras?


Con capacidad para gestionar el tiempo.
Capacidad analítica.
Colaborativo/a para trabajar en equipo.
Con autonomía y proactividad.
Mucha motivación por aprender.
Pasión por el Análisis de Datos.



Si crees que esta es tu oportunidad, ¡no dudes en inscribirte!¡Te estamos esperando!

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst
Description:
#hybrid-Barcelona

We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Life Science & Healthcare (Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease) therapy group in Barcelona.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insights generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

You will contribute Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease therapeutic expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global pharmaceutical customers. If you have passion for the dynamic oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in a Life Sciences or related discipline is required, focus on Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease is preferred.
2 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of the Infectious, Niche, Rare Disease field is required; familiarity with clinical drug development, commercialization processes, regulatory hurdles and access is desired.
Ability to interpret data and insights and turn into compelling, quality narratives through a commercial lens is required, with excellent attention to detail.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Keen interest in becoming a therapeutic indication-specific expert.
Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
Demonstrated ability in problem solving, decision making and using sound judgement aligned with team and company’s business objectives.
Comfortable in handling large datasets and information from multiple sources; comfort in ambiguity with ability to develop rational evidence-based arguments.
Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.
Strong interest in engaging with customers to solve their business needs.
Has a flexible, collaborative approach to work; exudes positivity and ‘can do’ attitude.


What will you be doing in this role?


Build and apply a strong understanding of disease-specific insights, including the dynamics of oncology Infectious, Niche and/or Rare disease markets, regulatory and commercial aspects of drug development and the wider pharmaceutical industry.
Critically analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., clinical trial data, commercial information, market research data) to evaluate market trends, competitive dynamics, assess opportunities and build forecasts.
Conduct primary market research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts in the oncology Infecious, Niche, Rare disease field, and secondary market research.
Write and produce high-quality syndicated (and custom) content independently or in collaboration with team members with minimal supervision, adhering to product specifications and timelines.
Communicate concisely and effectively disease-specific insights through multiple formats (e.g., business writing, slide decks, live presentations).
Field customer inquiries and ad hoc requests (internal and external) to high standard, showing strong grasp of complex clinical and commercial issues.
Interact effectively and efficiently with multiple stakeholders across the business (e.g., Commercial, Epidemiology, Support Services).


About The Team


We are an international and diverse team of 12 members (3 US based) with expertise in market research on infectious, niche and rare diseases.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive – excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.


Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

Kantar es la empresa líder mundial de datos, insights y consultoría.

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a entender a las personas e inspirar su crecimiento. Combinamos nuestra experiencia en comprensión humana con tecnologías avanzadas. Los 25.000 empleados de Kantar en más de 100 países ayudan a las principales organizaciones del mundo a tener éxito y crecer. Nadie conoce mejor a las personas que Kantar.

Aportamos conocimiento e inspiración para ayudar a nuestros clientes, a nuestra gente y a la sociedad a crear y prosperar en un mundo extraordinario.

En Worldpanel somos expertos mundiales en el comportamiento de los compradores, y ofreciendo un seguimiento continuo, análisis avanzados y soluciones a medida para inspirar las decisiones de éxito de las organizaciones líderes de todo el mundo. Worldpanel convierte el comportamiento de compra en una ventaja competitiva en un amplio abanico de mercados, como la tecnología, la moda, las telecomunicaciones y los bienes de consumo.

Misión del puesto

Actualmente estamos buscando un/una Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data Science, comprometido con la ejecución y entrega de soluciones Advanced Analytics.

La persona ideal para el puesto debe tener pasión por descubrir patrones a partir de grandes conjuntos de datos y trabajará con los equipos internos para entender mejor los problemas del negocio.

Si estás dispuesto/a a ir más allá de lo obvio, utilizando la inteligencia, la pasión y la creatividad para inspirar nuevas ideas y dar forma al mundo en que vivimos, ¡únete a nuestro equipo!

Responsabilidades


Realizar análisis estadísticos y aplicar las técnicas de Machine Learning asociados a las soluciones del porfolio de Advanced Analytics.
Crear visualizaciones de datos y comunicar los análisis y conclusiones a través de documentos y presentaciones.
Seguimiento y documentación de proyectos regulares junto con los equipos responsables.


Requisitos formativos


Titulación universitaria (Licenciatura o Máster) en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática o campos cuantitativos equivalentes.
Amplios conocimientos aplicados de métodos estadísticos, ciencia de datos y/o modelización analítica, con una amplia base de conocimientos sobre el panorama general del análisis de datos.
Se requiere una considerable experiencia previa en programación con R.
Dominio del inglés (nivel B2).
Se valorará conocimientos de Bases de Datos.
Se valorará cualquier conocimiento o experiencia previa en Power BI y en programación con SAS, aunque no es obligatorio.
Se valorará conocimiento de herramientas de control de versiones (Git)
Se valorará la experiencia previa con datos de paneles, compradores o encuestas, y en funciones similares.


Cualidades requeridas


Una persona curiosa, atenta al detalle, con pensamiento crítico, y que demuestre verdadera pasión por el comportamiento del consumidor.
Que sea capaz de analizar e interpretar los resultados, así como explicarlos a personas no técnicas. Que pueda conectar cómodamente con interlocutores de todos los niveles de la organización y facilitar los debates de forma constructiva.
Con proactividad, optimismo y dispuesto/a a implicarse para alcanzar las metas y objetivos del equipo.
Persona altamente colaboradora y adaptable, con capacidad para trabajar eficazmente en entornos ágiles.


Country

Spain

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
About Our Company

Schneider Electric is the global specialist in energy management and automation. With revenues of ~€25 billion in FY2016, our 144,000+ employees serve customers in over 100 countries, helping them to manage their energy and process in ways that are safe, reliable, efficient and sustainable. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Our connected technologies reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives.

At Schneider Electric, we call this Life Is On.

Who we are?

We are the Data Quality Team, part of the Data and Performance organization. We are leading the effort to improve the maturity of Data at its foundations. We are implementing new approaches, processes and roles to increase overall SE data quality, which means that Data is fit for purpose. quality of data is measured in a safe and cost-effective manner and it is sustainably maintained in its integrity and quality. 

The Data Quality team aim is to deploy across the organization a data quality process which is defined in its key steps as discovery, data profiling, identification of Critical Data Elements and definition of data quality check to assess their status, implementation of the quality control and of reporting based on their results, and issue management.

Major duties and responsibilities

As a Data Quality analyst, you will:


Gathers and structures information about DQ check from various sources
Manage the DQ check portfolio and facilitate its reusability across the data community
Collects and interprets data related to DQ issue management


As Part of the overall Data Quality Team:


Support the Data Quality process deployment as a service, within the agile development teams, building global re-usable data objects in order to facilitate the completion of the data quality deliverables
Participate in the definition and verification of best practices in the implementation of DQ Checks
Support Data Consumers and technical expert in the execution of DQ Issue Management and collects and interprets data


Qualifications


Engineering Graduate or Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
Experience 5 - 10 years with Quality process or Data management
Experience in reporting packages and in analyzing large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive report
Hands on experience on SQL
Knowledge of architecture and operating models design
Preferred some experience on data catoluging ,AWS, Informatica Cloud and BI tools (tableau).
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Travel up to 15% of time (in normal circumstances)
English fluency


What's in it for me?


Life insurance.
Health insurance
Flexible compensation: ticket restaurant , nursery, training, pension plan etc.
Own your career: Enjoy all the benefits of Open Talent Market, our platform that uses AI to connect you with hundreds of job opportunities, projects and mentors around the world.
Flex@Work: flexible hours, telework, sabbaticals, purchase leave, floating holidays, Global Family Leave Policy.
Recognize and be recognized through our StepUp program.
Club Schneider: discount on products and services throughout Spain.
Wellness: medical service, wellbeing laboratories, activities per workplace, gyms in different sites, etc.
If you like to go to the gym, we have a special agreement with Andjoy Become a Schneider shareholder with our "WESOP" program.
Many more benefits per site ... !


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

DIGDATA24

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

Discover your Meaningful, Inclusive and Empowered career at Schneider Electric.

€34.2bn global revenue

+12% organic growth

135 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.

We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Our connected technologies reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives.

We are the Data Quality Team, part of the Data and Performance organization. We are leading the effort to improve the maturity of Data at its foundations. Title: Data Analyst Senior (Pentaho / Tableau)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
DÉJANOS CONTARTE LO QUE NOS HACE GENUINE

Buscamos profesionales que quieran reinventarse cada día, que enfrentarse a los retos vaya en su ADN y que sientan pasión por trabajar con la tecnología. Esto nos hace únicos, diferentes y auténticos.




¿QUÉ ESTAMOS BUSCANDO?

Buscamos reforzar nuestro equipo con 1 nuevo compañero/a con perfil de Data Analyst Senior para trabajar dentro de un equipo muy estable, potente y bien organizado, participando en la evolución de la arquitectura Data de una multinacional líder en sector "Sports & Media".




Proyecto estable y con mucho recorrido profesional.




Modelo híbrido (Teletrabajo 3 días/ semana)

Oficinas en Sant Cugat (Barcelona)




Funciones:

Consolidar los datos de las diferentes áreas de negocio mediante ETL en Pentaho

Integración de los datos en el Datawarehouse.

Soporte a la herramienta de explotación de datos Tableau.




Requisitos:

· Experiencia en SQL

· Conocimientos en software de creación de ETLs (deseable Pentaho)

· Haber trabajado con algún software de visualización de datos (deseable Tableau )

· Acostumbrado a manejar grandes volúmenes de datos

· Conocimientos en administración de base de datos

· Capacidad de aplicar técnicas de optimización en consultas/procesos

· Experiencia accediendo a fuentes remotas vía API

· Familiarizado con el manejo de logs




PORQUE EN ENTELGY TODO COMIENZA CONTIGO

Cuidarte en todos los aspectos es una máxima en Entelgy, por ello, la conciliación es algo que valoramos y facilitamos con nuestro modelo de trabajo flexible, #Balance.

Nuestra cultura se vive en el día a día, somos como una gran familia y formamos Entelgy Family, donde podrás participar en actividades, eventos, concursos y mucho más. También tenemos un conjunto de iniciativas orientadas a potenciar que tengas una vida sana y equilibrada, como nuestra plataforma digital de Salud y Bienestar MyWellness, Health Training y Entelgy SportClub.

Además, con nuestro programa de Retribución Flexible MyFlex accederás a productos con ventaja económica y fiscal, así como podrás beneficiarte de más de 450 descuentos y ofertas especiales en nuestro portal MyClub y mucho más.




ASÍ ES COMO PONEMOS TODO NUESTRO TALENTO EN POTENCIAR EL TUYO

Ven para formar parte de nuestro equipo, y descubre que no es sólo lo que hacemos, sino cómo lo hacemos. ¡Atrévete a vivir una experiencia Genuine!

· Proyectos retadores para grandes clientes: Trabajarás en proyectos de gran relevancia para nuestros clientes, junto a un gran equipo de profesionales desde el primer día.

· Partners de las mejores tecnologías: AWS, Splunk, Red Hat, Microsoft, Opentext y Oracle, Celonis y más.

· Entelgy College: nuestra universidad pone a tu disposición una amplia oferta formativa en tecnologías, habilidades, certificaciones, 12 idiomas y mucho más. Tu decides en que quieres formarte.

Show more

Title: Business Insight Analyst 100% remote in Barcelona
Description:
Are you interested in continuing your development as a Business Insight Analyst in a multinational company dedicated to e-commerce, located in Barcelona?




Oxigent Technologies is looking for a BUSINESS INSIGHTS ANALYST to be in charge of monitoring the performance of the New App.




What are you core activities?




Update and maintain dashboards.
Support in accesses to dashboards.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to understand where issues are and how to improve the New app
Support for creating documentation (trainings, dashboards).
Maintenance of reference files, support to creation of improved/automated process for retrieving information from markets.




What's necessary?




Education: ideally Master in Data engineering or IT with Business diploma.
Experience: Min. 5 years as Analyst and background in Customer behavior analysis.
Languages: English (B2+), daily work




Technical skills:

Expert in PBI
Expert in SQL
Expert in Looker
Expert in GA4




Nice to have: Big Query




What do we offer you?




• Permanent contract.

• Salary according to the experience provided (up to 50.000 euros gross per year).

• International and multicultural environment.

• Educational vouchers.

• Full remote working model and flexible working hours.

• Private medical insurance.

• Special discounts on fitness and sport facilities.

• Tax reduction: you will be able to dedicate part of your gross salary to different options such as transport, ticket restaurant, education, kindergarten and health insurance.

• Many more benefits!

Title: Checkout Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Checkout Data Analyst (They/She/He) - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced Checkout Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid), which is passionate about data, automation, analysis and innovation and loves to work in a collaborative and agile environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Checkout Data Analyst in the Checkout team you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights
Own team metrics identifying the drivers of over and underperformance and providing data driven recommendations for how we can improve the KPIs performance
Turn business questions into functional analysis, extract relevant and actionable insights working with data from many different data sources using SQL/BQ and work with your stakeholders to make them happen
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions
Design and execute measurement experiments; Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the business stakeholders
Create dashboards and tracking: ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs, as well as, foster data-driven decision making across the organisation. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage relevant data
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects: participate in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python/R programming skills and experience with Looker Studio, Power BI will be valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail
Strong organisational and communication skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

I f you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge And Skills


Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP’s own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated activities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let’s have a talk!

Sales and Services Entity (ES11)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Marketing Data Analyst into our Analytics team.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Zynga and Socialpoint.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the Marketing and user Acquisition teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Ensure the data that senior stakeholders use to support key decisions is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics


Requirements


2-3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g statistics, math, computer science or similar). Master’s degree in a relevant field will also be valued.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL and databases.
Basic Python skills for data analysis and automation tasks.
Experience using data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker…)
Excellent communication skills, know how to work in a team, prioritize and manage your own workload.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently


Nice-to-haves


Experience in a mobile B2C business.
Experience implementing data science models with Python.
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analyzing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!


Benefits

Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Network Engineer in Barcelona. Start your new adventure in an international and agile Environment by identifying opportunities for improvement at the technical, functional, and organizational levels.




Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With a tailor-made career path, develop your skills and work on challenging projects for one of our more than 1000 clients across the globe. Being 6,350 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries you will feel part of our talented and international community. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information Systems & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences, and Engineering.




We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is in step with you to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.







👉WHAT WILL YOU DO? 👈

·      Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities

·      Prioritize needs coming from stakeholders

·      Perform functional research and design to determine possible solutions

·      Construct ad-hoc financial models and analyses to support deliverables

·      Perform functional testing and user acceptance testing

·      Conduct data discovery and profiling for fit and gap analysis

·      Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty

·      Actively contribute to team ceremonies including: sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives

·      Demonstrate a strong ownership in understanding business needs and driving business valued outcome

·      Communicate on outcomes to stakeholders to ensure understanding of progress and potential roadblocks.







👉WHAT DO WE NEED? 👈




·      University degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent

·      5+ years of accounting or finance experience

·      2+ years of hands on experience with SAP ECC or S/4

·      Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel

·      Comfortable writing SQL queries

·      Passionate about learning everyday

·      Customer satisfaction & Business oriented

·      Strong communication skills

·      Experience with PySpark

·      Fluent in English




Preferred qualifications:

·      Experience with AWS

·      Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)







🚀WHY US? 🚀




We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve ourselves to the best. Working next to super-talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of our colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, and that’s why we can offer:




Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of €565M and over 1,000 clients across the world

Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people from over 60 countries and 5 continents, being able to benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors.

Flexibility is the order of the day, so we have friendly remote policies, an intensive workday, as well as social benefits such as Transit, Restaurant or Kindergarten ticket, and Private Health Insurance

Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path and salary evaluation: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level

Develop your skills with our Tech Academy catalogue in last technologies, access the Udemy E-learning Platform with over 500 training courses, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, and project management, and participate in our Webinars and Workshops.

Choose your own training course with your annual personal budget and take advantage of our partners getting certifications paid for by the company.

Feel part of our Community by being part of our Languages sessions, Team buildings, Afterword hangouts, and the Event of the Year.

We have the We Care program, where the company aid critically affected employees.

Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/jobs




Equal Opportunity⚖️:




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (SAP BW)
Description:
Your new role:




Development of data models and transformations in SAP BW to fulfill reporting requirements
Development and monitoring of SAP BW loading jobs
Development of Reports with AfO and SAC based on SAP BW data models
Development of CDS Views in Source Systems (S/4 Retail) as Datasoure
Development of Views in GCP BigQuery as Datasource for SAP BW
SAC Administration Tasks
Development of SAC Dashboards




Requirements:




Experience with SAP BI platforms and very good technology knowledge in SAP BW on HANA, HANA Native, SAP BO, SAP BI-IP, SAP Analytics Cloud
Experience in an engineering / technology role, ideally in agile product environments / teams
Experience working in agile product teams, DevOps methods and continuous delivery with a focus on optimizing customer benefits
Very good written and spoken English skills, German is an advantage
Willingness to be on call on occasional weekends




What we offer:




Permanent contract directly with the end client
Young and dynamic environment
10% discount on the brand
Language classes
Training budget
Career plan

Competitive salary
Hybrid mode (1 day in-person/week)

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
El Parc Taulí és un Hospital Universitari que té la missió d’oferir una atenció sanitària i social de qualitat, resolutiva, integral i que fomenta l’equitat i la satisfacció en un marc de sostenibilitat, integrant la docència, la recerca i la innovació. Som una entitat d’excel·lència i la nostra raó de ser és la prestació dels serveis sanitaris a la nostra població de referència, com a entitat pública eficient i generadora de valor per al territori.

El Parc Taulí desitja incorporar al seu equip un analista de dades per treballar en la transformació de dades en informació, que ha de permetre generar coneixement per a la presa de decisions i implementar un model de gestió d’excel·lència orientat al client intern i extern, com a palanca de transformació de l’organització.

Funcions generals:

Dissenyar, desenvolupar, supervisar i desplegar estructures de dades per a consum de sistemes analítics de manera eficient.
Dissenyar i elaborar informes / reporting i quadres de comandament / dashboards, que permetin una navegació efectiva per facilitar la presa de decisions.
Participar en l’estratègia de governança, qualitat i emmagatzematge de dades.
Participar en la presa de requisits d'usuari i definició de mètriques i construcció de KPIs.

Requisits:

Titulació universitària en Ciència de Dades, Big Data, Informàtica, Enginyeria, Telecomunicacions, ADE, Matemàtiques, Estadística o altres titulacions vinculades a les funcions.

Es valorarà:

Currículum.
Experiència professional amb l’eina Power BI i programació en DAX.
Expertesa en solucions de Business Intelligence.
Experiència en la gestió de les fases d’un projecte BI (de la presa de requeriments fins al desplegament).
Coneixements de programació en Power Query.
Experiència en bases de dades, Phyton, R i SQL avançat.
Coneixements en sistemes i tecnologies SSAS Tabular.
Coneixement de modelatge dimensional.
Experiència en el disseny de dahsboards.
Expertesa en Excel avançat.
Gestió de projectes utilitzant tecnologies àgils.
Coneixement de machine learning i deep learning.
Experiència en el sector sanitari.
Capacitat de treball en equip, compromís i proactivitat.
Orientació a resultats i a client.

S’ofereix:

Incorporació immediata a l’equip de treball de la Direcció de Gestió (dependència funcional) i de la Direcció d’Estratègia Digital i Dades (dependència orgànica) del Consorci Corporació Sanitària Taulí.

Condicions:

- Jornada completa de 37,25 hores setmanals.

- Àmplia oferta de formació continuada i possibilitat de realitzar formació.




Suma’t al nostre equip i participa de la transformació de l’atenció sanitària aportant el teu talent analític. Si ets un professional amb passió per les dades aquesta és una oportunitat excepcional per marcar la diferència i deixar la teva empremta en el món de la salut!




Show more
