Title: Data Engineer Intermediate
HTML:
Tarefas

A Noesis procura candidatos com o seguinte perfil:

  • Analisar e estruturar dados brutos;
  • Construir sistemas de dados e pipelines;
  • Avaliar as necessidades e objetivos das BUs;
  • Dar suporte à operação contínua de pipelines de dados;
  • Interpretar tendências e padrões;
  • Avaliar análises complexas de dados e explorar os resultados;
  • Desenhar e especificar arquitetura técnica e respetivos requisitos;
  • Desenvolvimento, integração e teste das componentes disponibilizadas no projeto.

Requisitos

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia de Software ou Engenharia informática ou similar;
  • Até 5 anos de experiência enquanto Data Engineer;
  • Conhecimentos da metodologia Agile, ferramenta JIRA e Confluence (valorizados);
  • Boa capacidade comunicação escrita e verbal;
  • Capacidade de trabalho em ambiente colaborativo e com equipas globais;
  • Capacidade de análise crítica e focada em resolução de problemas;
  • Compromisso de qualidade de entregas;
  • Conhecimentos do mercado Energy & Utilities e RGPD (valorizado);
  • Experiência em projetos (valorizado);
  • Conhecimento de idiomas (escrito e oral): inglês (obrigatório), português (valorizado), espanhol (valorizado);

Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura.

Join us. Let’s innovate together!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job


BNPP Global Markets Americas is looking to expand its team of dedicated data engineers in Portugal to support Prime Services, part of the Global Equities Global Business Line (GBL).
The team in Portugal works closely with Prime Services Prime Trading Americas. This team is focused on generating business analytics, building data pipelines, and projects implementation to better position the business for their current and future needs. A primary focus of the role is assisting in the improvement of funding efficiencies and meeting client demand through improved data availability and analysis, client insights, and ultimately through enhanced data and business processes. The ability to work with large amount of messy data and designing and then implementing improved data models will be important. A successful candidate should have strong communication skills, be a team player, have the ability to learn quickly, and focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment. The job will require interaction with Front Office, Technology, and Product Development.


Your Main Activities Are


The required position would support Equity Financing business in its reporting : creation / automation / monitoring (both the indicators produced and the fact that report is being produced)
Within the Support team, the individual will work closely with Front Office and Quant Research :
Monitor production of daily reports required by the business :
Trouble shot with IT in case of production issue
Data quality check day over day. Escalation to Operations (MO) and Front in case of booking issue
Improve automation of reports production
Work with Business and Quant to enhance existing reports with new data / method
Automate production from XL based template to server based production
Design new reports, and provide analysis and optimization suggestion
Work with business to enhance our reporting framework to display more relevant indicators
Once familiar with data, help in the analysis of the reports , highlight outsiders and suggest improvements
Ability to travel to New York for a period of up to 1 month for on-desk experience and training

Profile and Skills to Success


BA, BS or MS degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance or Economics)
1-4 years of relevant experience such as in Data Analytics or Engineering
Experience in Capital Markets or Investment Banking
Perfect fluency in English
Good communication skills
Proficiency in Python, SQL Excel and VBA
Quantitative, analytical and logical problem solving skill
Basic knowledge of financial markets and Prime Brokerage
Experience using Dev-ops tools such as GIT, Jira and APIs


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: 21 - Data Engineer
HTML:
Procuras uma empresa que seja especializada nas áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation?

A PPM Coachers apresenta uma oferta de serviços completa e integrada, tanto nas componentes tradicionais como nas abordagens Agile e que vai desde a Consultoria Estratégica com o desenho de modelos de Demand Management Office (DMO), Project Management Office (PMO) e Service Managament Office (SMO), até a Implementação e Operacionalização de processos, técnicas e ferramentas, passando pelo Reforço da Capacidade (outsourcing) e Desenvolvimento de Competências como uma ferramenta indispensável para suportar a transformação organizacional inerente aos processos de evolução.

Porquê a PPM Coachers?

  • Terás oportunidade de participar em projetos chave com os maiores players nacionais e internacionais do mercado, onde colocarás em prática todo o teu conhecimento dentro das áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation.
  • Dispomos de uma equipa experiente, sólida e dinâmica que te irá acompanhar de forma personalizada nesta tua jornada e te ajudará a desenvolver competências nas áreas em que somos especialistas.

A PPM Coachers está a recrutar para a função de Data Engineer!

A Tua Missão

  • Atender tickets e lidar com pedidos de clientes e operadores, como solicitações relacionadas com cartões de navegação;
  • Realizar a manutenção diária dos dados para garantir que tudo esteja a funcionar corretamente;
  • Sincronizar dados diários com outros departamentos;
  • Desenvolver novos projetos e fazer manutenção em ferramentas internas após o período inicial de tarefas diárias;
  • Trabalhar com transações publicadas no Kafka e processadas por meio do Airflow;
  • Armazenar e manipular dados com PySpark;
  • Entregar dados de maneira estruturada aos departamentos e operadores que precisam deles;
  • Facilitar a chegada dos dados a quem realmente necessita e desenvolver novas estruturas conforme as necessidades dos operadores de transportes;
  • Lidar com desenvolvimentos internacionais e plataformas externas, integrando fluxos de dados no big data.

Requisitos mínimos

  • Experiência comprovada em gestão e análise de dados, preferencialmente em ambientes de grandes volumes de dados (big data);
  • Experiência prática com as seguintes tecnologias: Kafka, Airflow, PySpark e SQL;
  • Experiência com bases de dados Oracle, com desenvolvimento em SQL;
  • Experiência com a linguagem de programação Python, especialmente em contexto de análise e processamento de dados;
  • Capacidade de lidar com tickets e pedidos de clientes e operadores de forma eficaz;
  • Habilidade para desenvolver novos projetos e fazer manutenção com ferramentas internas;
  • Conhecimento de metodologias ágeis e experiência a trabalhar em equipas multifuncionais;
  • Capacidade de adaptação a mudanças legais e outras prioridades da equipa;
  • Experiência em lidar com desenvolvimentos internacionais e integração de fluxos de dados em plataformas externas;
  • Fortes competências analíticas e de resolução de problemas;
  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicação para interagir eficazmente com diferentes departamentos e stakeholders;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autónoma e em equipa, demonstrando proatividade e atenção aos detalhes.
  • Facilidade de comunicação e de relacionamento, bem como capacidade de explicar e apresentar temas complexos para diferentes públicos-alvo;
  • Capacidade analítica;
  • Dinamismo.

Local: Lisboa

Modelo de Trabalho: Híbrido 2x

Modelo de Contrato: Prestação de Serviços (Rate dia + IVA)

Disponibilidade: Imediata

Title: Distributed Cloud | Data Analyst w/Looker
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Our Devoteam Distributed Cloud Unit is looking for a skilled Data Visualization / Analytics Engineer to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in Power BI, including DAX measures, UX/UI design, data storytelling, and performance optimization for large datasets. Experience with other Data Visualization tools like Looker or Qlik and proficiency in data modeling techniques, particularly dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology, are highly valued.

If this opportunity is for you, apply today!

We will rely on you to


Power BI Development:


Design and maintain advanced Power BI reports and dashboards.


Create complex DAX measures and optimize data models.


Implement UI/UX best practices for effective data presentation.


Utilize composite models and pre-aggregations for high data volumes.


Data Storytelling:


Translate data findings into compelling visual stories.


Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.


Collaborate with business units to gather requirements.


Data Modeling:


Design and implement efficient data models using dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology.


Ensure scalability, maintainability, and performance of data models.


Integrate data sources and optimize ETL processes.


Knowledge of Looker is valued, as well as other visualization tools


Leverage Looker visualization and semantic model capabilities.


Stay updated on trends in data visualization.


Performance Optimization:


Monitor and improve BI solution performance.


Implement best practices for data management and query performance.


Handle large datasets efficiently.


Collaboration and Support:


Work with data engineers, scientists, and analysts on BI solutions.


Provide training and support to enhance data literacy.



Qualifications



Experience:


Proven experience as a Data Visualization/Analytics Engineer, at least 5 years;


Extensive experience with Power BI, including DAX, data modeling, and performance tuning;


Experience with Looker is valued;


Strong background in dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology preferred;


Technical Skills:


Proficiency in SQL;


Knowledge of ETL processes and tools;


Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud;


Experience with Python or R is a plus;


Understanding of data governance and quality principles is also a plus;


Soft Skills:


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;


Strong communication and interpersonal skills;


Ability to work collaboratively in a team;


Attention to detail and quality;


Preferred Certifications:


Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals


Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate


Looker Certified Looker Business Analyst or equivalent

Show more
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Our Devoteam Distributed Cloud Unit is looking for a skilled Data Visualization / Analytics Engineer to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in Power BI, including DAX measures, UX/UI design, data storytelling, and performance optimization for large datasets. Experience with other Data Visualization tools like Looker or Qlik and proficiency in data modeling techniques, particularly dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology, are highly valued.

If this opportunity is for you, apply today!

We will rely on you to

  • Power BI Development:

    • Design and maintain advanced Power BI reports and dashboards.

    • Create complex DAX measures and optimize data models.

    • Implement UI/UX best practices for effective data presentation.

    • Utilize composite models and pre-aggregations for high data volumes.

  • Data Storytelling:

    • Translate data findings into compelling visual stories.

    • Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.

    • Collaborate with business units to gather requirements.

  • Data Modeling:

    • Design and implement efficient data models using dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology.

    • Ensure scalability, maintainability, and performance of data models.

    • Integrate data sources and optimize ETL processes.

  • Knowledge of Looker is valued, as well as other visualization tools

    • Leverage Looker visualization and semantic model capabilities.

    • Stay updated on trends in data visualization.

  • Performance Optimization:

    • Monitor and improve BI solution performance.

    • Implement best practices for data management and query performance.

    • Handle large datasets efficiently.

  • Collaboration and Support:

    • Work with data engineers, scientists, and analysts on BI solutions.

    • Provide training and support to enhance data literacy.


Qualifications

  • Experience:

    • Proven experience as a Data Visualization/Analytics Engineer, at least 5 years;

    • Extensive experience with Power BI, including DAX, data modeling, and performance tuning;

    • Experience with Looker is valued;

    • Strong background in dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology preferred;

  • Technical Skills:

    • Proficiency in SQL;

    • Knowledge of ETL processes and tools;

    • Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud;

    • Experience with Python or R is a plus;

    • Understanding of data governance and quality principles is also a plus;

  • Soft Skills:

    • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;

    • Strong communication and interpersonal skills;

    • Ability to work collaboratively in a team;

    • Attention to detail and quality;

  • Preferred Certifications:

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals

  • Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate

  • Looker Certified Looker Business Analyst or equivalent

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for an Data Engineer. The ideal candidate embodies technical prowess in Cloud Data Engineering, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is full remote.

Note: All applications/CV’s must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Architect and implement data models, ensuring data integrity, quality, and consistency
Develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to deliver insights to stakeholders
Optimize performance and reliability of data systems through monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting
Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in data engineering, analytics, and visualization
Mentor junior team members and contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering practices within the organization


Requirements For The Role


Proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on Microsoft Fabric and/or TimeXtender
Strong proficiency in SQL, T-SQL, and data modeling concepts
Hands-on experience with designing and building data pipelines, ETL processes, and data warehouses
Expertise in developing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI is a plus
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of €8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration – Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer

• Customized Career path|People-oriented goals

About Our Client

Cliente da área de Financial Services, parte do Grupo que contempla entidades de Banca, Seguros e Risco.

Job Description

  • Integrar equipa de Reporting financeiro e Gestão de Dados;
  • Garantir o conhecimento ao nível da gestão de dados dos múltiplos sistemas da empresa;
  • Realizar a extracção de informação integrada nos múltiplos sistemas;
  • Assegurar a extracção dos dados dos sistemas origem, a transformação e representação ao nível de modelos de análise de dados (SQL e Python);
  • Garantir a representação e gestão da informação ao nível da Operational Data Store, Data Warehouse e Datamarts;
  • Assegurar a revisão e validação dos dados recebidos, garantindo a sua qualidade;
  • Utilização de ferramentas workflow de orquestração;
  • Desenvolvimento de dashboards

The Successful Applicant

  • 3 anos de experiência em Busines Intelligence. Analytics, Dados ou equivalente;
  • Experiência profissional com Python e Microsoft SQL Server (mandatório)
  • Licenciatura Pré-Bolonha ou Mestrado Integrado em Sistemas de Informação ou similares;
  • Experiência profissional na implementação de soluções na área de Seguros e/ou Servços;
  • Tecnologias: Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services; Microsoft SQL Server Management; Microsoft Visual Studio; Power BI; SAS Data Integration.

What's on Offer

Diversidade de funções, responsabilidades e crescimento

Progressão de carreira

Acompanhamento multidisciplinar

Contact: Goncalo Castelbranco

Quote job ref: JN-072024-6468762

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Local de Trabalho:

LISBOA

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Data Engineer

O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, ou similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 4 anos como Data Engineer;
  • Experiência profissional com SQL Server e Python;
  • Conhecimentos de SSIS;
  • Domínio do Inglês (obrigatório).

#babel

Na Babel oferecemos:

  • Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
  • Contrato indeterminado;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Sistema de férias inovador;
  • Participação nos lucros da empresa.

Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Em cumprimento com a legislação vigente em matéria de proteção de dados, informamos que o GRUPO BABEL é responsável pelos seus dados pessoais e que os utilizará para levar a cabo processos de recrutamento interno, com base no seu consentimento, mediante o fornecimento dos seus dados curriculares e na aplicação de medidas pré-contratuais. Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Job Req Number: 72084

Time Type:

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Become part of The Centre of Insights and Analytics (CIA) team that is working with all DSV business divisions as well as Group Functions to simplify information gathering and turning data into insight
Create visually powerful dashboards in Microsoft Power BI that turn data into information
Champion user experience best practices for business stakeholders
Be a business partner for both business divisions/Group Functions as well as IT departments, acting as an interface to bring business intelligence to the next level
Support BI management in the implementation of the Global BI Roadmap
Design, develop, document and maintain business intelligence solutions
Support the advanced analytics team in creating advanced analytics solutions
Work in projects together with the business partners internally
Act as knowledge hub for Microsoft Power BI to empower business partners



Our requirements:



University degree in IT, business studies or any related studies
Minimum 2 years of experience in similar position (Business Intelligence)
Proven expert knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (focus on Microsoft Power BI)
Ability to visualize information in a value adding way
Experience with complex DAX functions and Power Query
Deep knowledge of BI processes and good practices characteristic for a large corporation
Practical SQL scripting knowledge (ideally SQL Server with optimization knowledge)
Azure Data Stack knowledge (Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2), with special focus on Databricks
Knowledge of advanced analytics / data science methodologies and tools (R, python, Pytorch)
Knowledge of data modelling concepts
Basic knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse
Basic knowledge of financial data structures
Fluent English both spoken and written



What we offer:



Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance (EUR 8.32, per working day)
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of more than 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon

LIVE

What You Will Do

As a Data Engineer at Amgen, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the company's data infrastructure and architecture for Clinical Data Hub. You will design and implement data pipelines, develop data models, perform data integration, and ensure data quality and governance. Your expertise in data engineering, big data technologies, and data manipulation will contribute to the effective storage, processing, and utilization of large-scale data sets. In partnership with enterprise data platform teams, functional technology teams and data scientists, the Sr Data Engineer – Clinical Data Hub will be part of a team delivering key clinical trial data initiatives that are contributing to the advancement of a connected data vision, including the Enterprise Data Fabric (EDF). A connected data ecosystem is a key dependency to realize critical business strategies across Research and Development, such as AI/ML and precision medicine.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaboration and Planning: Work with Product Owner, Product Management, Agile Team, and Data Architects to plan and deliver prioritized Clinical Data Hub backlog items and optimize the technical environment.
Data Management: Ensure data requirements for applications, data scientists, and cross-functional use cases are met, and ensure high performance and reliability of the system.
Technical Implementation: Design, code, test, and review data pipelines to standards and best practices for clinical data solutions.
Lifecycle Support and Maintenance: Maintain, patch, and upgrade data pipeline solutions to maintain security and regulatory compliance, performance standards, and platform best practices.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Basic Qualifications:

Master’s degree in computer science or closely related degree program

OR

Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of data engineering experience

OR

Associate’s degree and 6 years of data engineering experience

OR

High school diploma / GED and 8 years of data engineering experience

Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of development experience with Databricks, including cluster setup, execution, and tuning
2+ years of experience building ETL or ELT pipelines; Hands-on experience with SQL
Experience with one or more programming languages, Python, R, SAS, Scala, or Java.
Experience with Software engineering best-practices, including but not limited to version control, infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD, and automated testing
Experience in clinical trial design and analysis
Experience in clinical Data Lake and Data Fabric space
Experience with data modeling, performance tuning, and experience on relational and graph databases.
Experience with AWS services: EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift/Spectrum, Lambda, Glue, Athena, API gateway, and design patterns (Containers, Serverless, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more

Title: 21 - Developer PL/SQL
HTML:
Procuras uma empresa que seja especializada nas áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation?

A PPM Coachers apresenta uma oferta de serviços completa e integrada, tanto nas componentes tradicionais como nas abordagens Agile e que vai desde a Consultoria Estratégica com o desenho de modelos de Demand Management Office (DMO), Project Management Office (PMO) e Service Managament Office (SMO), até a Implementação e Operacionalização de processos, técnicas e ferramentas, passando pelo Reforço da Capacidade (outsourcing) e Desenvolvimento de Competências como uma ferramenta indispensável para suportar a transformação organizacional inerente aos processos de evolução.

Porquê a PPM Coachers?

  • Terás oportunidade de participar em projetos chave com os maiores players nacionais e internacionais do mercado, onde colocarás em prática todo o teu conhecimento dentro das áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation.
  • Dispomos de uma equipa experiente, sólida e dinâmica que te irá acompanhar de forma personalizada nesta tua jornada e te ajudará a desenvolver competências nas áreas em que somos especialistas.

A PPM Coachers está a recrutar para a função de Developer PL/SQL!

A Tua Missão

  • Analisar requisitos de negócio e traduzir em soluções técnicas;
  • Manter bases de dados, realizar atualizações e correções;
  • Implementar e monitorizar scripts de automação para processos de ETL;
  • Fornecer suporte técnico e resolver problemas de desempenho de consultas;
  • Participar na revisões de código e garantir práticas recomendadas;
  • Verificar a importação diária de dados e aplicar correções;
  • Verificar que os algoritmos de repartição diários correram como esperado, analisar e corrigir em caso negativo;
  • Desenvolver em PL/SQL para elaboração de mapas, dashboards e interface de dados entre os sistemas da companhia.

Requisitos mínimos

  • Formação superior em Informática, Sistemas de Informação ou áreas semelhantes;
  • Experiência profissional como PL/SQL Developer, preferencialmente em projetos de desenvolvimento e manutenção de sistemas;
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento e manutenção de consultas SQL para recuperação e manipulação de dados;
  • Colaboração na identificação e resolução de problemas de desempenho em consultas;
  • Capacidade analítica;
  • Dinamismo.

Local: Lisboa

Modelo de Trabalho: Híbrido 2x

Modelo de Contrato: Prestação de Serviços (Rate dia + IVA)

Disponibilidade: Imediata

Title: BI Developer
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Degree in Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum of 2 years of professional experience as BI Developer with the following technologies: Oracle/Microsoft;
  • Strong knowledge of Oracle (PL/SQL) and Microsoft (SQL Server) databases;
  • Knowledge of ETL processes is valued;
  • Experience in data integration and migration;
  • Experience with analytical and reporting solutions (Tableau, PowerBI or similar technologies) is a plus;
  • Autonomy and proactivity;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Good level of English.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
What You’ll Do

  • Accountable for bridging business requirements into analytics’ models, such as BI and Big Data;
  • Produces both high and detailed level design documents which steers the implementation to outstanding standards;
  • Responsible to have an integrated and E2E view from source to report, including Campaign systems’ impacts and outcomes;
  • Ensure and contribute to Team’s growth by sharing knowledge, leading to improve Team’s performance.


Who You Are

  • Degree in computer science or related field;
  • 7 years of work experience as a Data Engineer;
  • This role implies many interactions with different stakeholders. Therefore, excellent communication skills are required;
  • Should be a technology early adopter, have computing skills and expertise in different analytics/BI environments;
  • Team management experience is a nice to have;
  • Must have strong SQL skills;
  • Must have “hands-on” Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience;
  • Excellent knowledge of GCP components, such as BigQuery, Datafusion, Dataflow, Composer, Dataproc, Airflow;
  • Kafka and Talend knowledge would be valued;
  • Should possess knowledge on fundamental Unix/Linux


Not a perfect fit?

Worried that you don’t meet all the desired criteria exactly? At Vodafone we are passionate about Inclusion for All and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another role, and our recruitment team can help you see how your skills fit in.

What's In It For You

We want you to feel happy and fulfilled at work, without compromising the other things in life that matter to you. There are lots of ways we support this, including hybrid working and generous parental leave. You'll also get four Spirit Days a year to focus on your personal development and wellbeing, plus a host of other great benefits too.

Who We Are

You may have already heard of Vodafone - We're a leading Telecommunications company in Europe and Africa. But what you might not know is that we are continuously investing in new technologies to improve the lives of millions of customers, businesses and people around the world, creating a better future for everyone.

As part of our global family, whether that's Vodafone, Vodacom or _VOIS, you'll feel a sense of pride and purpose as you contribute to our culture of innovation. We pursue equality of opportunity and inclusion for all candidates through our employment policies and practices. We recognise and celebrate the importance of diversity and inclusivity in our workspace and we do not tolerate any form of discrimination especially related to but not limited to race, colour, age, veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation, pregnancy, ethnicity, disability, religion, political affiliation, trade union membership, nationality, indigenous status, medical condition, HIV status, social origin, cultural background, social, or marital status.

Together we can.

Founded in 1995, we are an international tech consulting company certified by Great Place to Work and in second place in The Best Workplaces 23. We offer innovative solutions to support our clients in their digital transformation. We have over a thousand talents specialized in different technologies, with offices in Portugal, Spain, the Netherlands, Brazil, Ireland, and the USA. Over the years, we have grown and expanded, always staying true to our core values of excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction. Today, we are a leading player in our industry, with a reputation for delivering cutting-edge solutions that exceed our client's expectations.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application. Join us. Let's innovate together!

Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an agile & result-driven person looking for opportunities in a multicultural, secure & fast-paced work environment? AUTODOC is a multicultural tech-company active in 27 countries and with ~5000 people from over 50 nations where things are going fast-forward.

We are currently in a transformative phase and looking for innovative, tech-driven, and agile people to join us. We are striving to create an environment where people are safe and supported — whether it’s in an office space or work-at-home.

Would this fit you, or do you know someone who would fit this description, then please contact us now and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.







Responsibilities:




Gathering and understanding business needs and objectives.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting.
Configure, implement and control the quality of analytics solutions.
Manage data analytics team and produce project deliverables.
Measure the performance of the project and provide optimization suggestions.
Partner with the Data Engineering team to define and build reliable data sources.
Work directly with senior management and recommend solutions and feature improvements.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in data, product analytics, or business intelligence. Bachelor's degree in any related field.
Comprehensive knowledge of e-commerce area, funnels, customer journey, and pricing strategies.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel.
Proven experience designing and enhancing dashboards using BI tools.
Experience turning complex data results into meaningful visualizations with clear insights.
Deep understanding of principles of building a data warehouse and data modeling.
Good communication skills, and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with A/B testing.
Fluent English.




Plus:

Experience in statistical analysis methods.
Understanding of the SDLC principles.
Developing BI solutions.




Additional Information:

Competitive salary based on your professional experience
Stable employment in the fast-growing international company
Wide benefit system
Dynamic work environment
Ability to influence business and its results
Professional growth — you will attend free external and internal courses
Paid business trips and payment for participation in conferences
Paid corporate language classes (English, German, Polish)
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST (HYBRID)
Description:
HYBRID LISBON ( 3 DAYS A WEEK)

ONLY RESUMES IN ENGLISH WILL BE ACCEPTED

For the Insurance area

About The Vacancy


The Data Analyst is a hands-on position with a focus on defining the data needs for the enterprise data warehouse. The position will work within IT to help Sompo International create an industry-leading data warehouse architecture. Furthermore, this data warehouse architecture will measure performance in all aspects of the organization’s operations.


Responsabilities


Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to analyze and resolve data issues for the enterprise data warehouse.
Create source (OLTP applications) to target (DWH) mapping documents to capture additional application data elements.
Load the source-to-target mapping documents from source systems into the enterprise data warehouse.
Collaborate with the ETL team to ensure the source-to-target mapping documents are in correct ETL code.
Ensure the ETL code align with STM requirements.
Perform data validation, to insure correct data movement into the enterprise data warehouse architecture.
Consult with reporting teams to develop a general understanding for the data warehouse model / optimal ways to use it.


Mandatory Requirements


B.S. Degree in Computer Information Science, Information Management, or Statistics.
Proven 3+ years’ experience of data analysis – extraction of OLTP data within an enterprise data warehouse.
Possess 3+ years of Policy & Claims Insurance subject-matter expertise.
Candidate has advanced level SQL knowledge.
Possess optimal knowledge for concepts and frameworks for Data Warehousing, ETL, and BI Architectures.
Candidate is capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views.
Able to facilitate data discovery sessions, which will include an audience of business subject-matter experts.
Proven knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g., SQL Server, DB2), with experience in generating DDL.
Possess knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications with their data is considered a plus.


General Qualifications


Candidate has strong interpersonal skills, including both written and verbal communication skills.
Possess the ability to work as part of a team.
Candidate has strong organizational skills and analysis skills.


Location:

Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Colorado Springs, CO; Conshohocken, PA; Dallas, TX; Fargo, ND; Florham Park, NJ; Garden City, NY; Houston, TX; Jacksonville, IL; Lenexa, KS; Los Angeles, CA; Lubbock, TX; Mt Juliet, TN; New York, NY; Purchase, NY; Topeka, KS

HI#590504

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

What we’re looking for:

We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join our new Pricing Data Team. As a part of the Pricing Domain, this team will be responsible for collecting pricing data, such as reference prices and competitive signals, to boost customer experience and power our decision-making.

Responsibilities


Building a corresponding dashboard and analysis to comprehend reference price coverage, driving the promotional processes across the entire company.
Constructing a dashboard and analysis in the competitor signals area to enhance our understanding of Autodoc's price positioning among competitors.
Working on improving the matching process, transitioning from manual matching of items to an automatic matching system.
Collaborating with other tech specialists, including developers, manual QA, and automatic QA, to develop a full-cycle solution.



Requirements


3+ years experience working in an analytics-focused role; e-commerce experience a plus.
BA in Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field;
Master’s degree or equivalent experience in Economics, Mathematics, or Computer Science preferred.



Hard Skills


Advanced SQL capabilities.
Python.
Power BI.
Experience working with algorithmic pricing systems and parsers Competera, PriceLab, etc. will be your advantage
Experience working with ML in terms of matching problems will be your advantage.
Advanced Excel user (Power Query, Power Pivot, Power View, DAX)
Ability to work with large amounts of data and draw conclusions useful for business on their basis
B2+ English



Soft Skills


Good understanding of the marketing and business processes of the e-commerce company
Ability to find points of growth / possible areas of optimization in the company's work and formulate action plans for implementing changes
Mindset on an independent search for facts. Ability to deal with uncertainty in data. Ability to ask questions correctly and formulate clear answers to them
Readiness for continuous development, expansion of the range of professional skills, and automation of routine operations.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes - Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Middle/Senior Data Analyst (FinTech Domain)
Description:
Company Description

We're seeking an accomplished Data Analyst with expertise in data visualization and statistical analysis, proficient in tools such as SQL, Python, and Tableau. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative team environment. This role goes beyond data crunching, encompassing responsibilities in data modeling, data interpretation, reporting, technical design, testing, documentation, and maintenance.

Our client has rapidly become one of Europe’s most fastest-growing fintech companies. They manage all aspects of financial operations, from generating virtual cards to facilitating wire transfers and maintaining customer account balances. As a payment institution, our client provides a platform integrating financial services into its product, including features like account management, card payments, bank transfers, and additional services.

CUSTOMER

Our customer is a leading FinTech company founded in 2016, offering a comprehensive spending solution designed for finance teams to facilitate faster and smarter spending decisions. Rapidly growing, they now serve over 4,000 customers and boast an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote locations. They have raised over €260M from prominent investors and have been recognized as a tech unicorn in France, with ambitious plans for continued expansion.

, Job Description


Collect, organize, and maintain accurate high-quality data from various sources
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and troubleshoot any data-related issues
Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards; communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders
Design and implement data analytics solutions for specific business domains, utilizing data science tools and techniques
Support process improvement initiatives by providing data-driven insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Work closely with clients and business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure high-quality data reporting, and deliver impactful presentations


, Qualifications


3+ years of Data-related experience
Proven ability to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data reporting
Strong knowledge of Python
Significant experience with Looker
Proficiency in visual analytics tools such as Power BI and Tableau
Strong experience in communicating effectively with clients and business stakeholders
Ability to deliver impactful presentations and convey key points from data analysis
Good understanding of machine learning instruments and algorithms
Broad experiencein exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
Experience in implementing and delivering data science and analytics solutions with measurable business impact
At least an Upper-Intermediate level of English

  • Design and implement data analytics solutions for specific business domains, utilizing data science tools and techniques
  • Support process improvement initiatives by providing data-driven insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
  • Work closely with clients and business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure high-quality data reporting, and deliver impactful presentations

, Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Data-related experience
  • Proven ability to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data reporting
  • Strong knowledge of Python
  • Significant experience with Looker
  • Proficiency in visual analytics tools such as Power BI and Tableau
  • Strong experience in communicating effectively with clients and business stakeholders
  • Ability to deliver impactful presentations and convey key points from data analysis
  • Good understanding of machine learning instruments and algorithms
  • Broad experiencein exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
  • Experience in implementing and delivering data science and analytics solutions with measurable business impact
  • At least an Upper-Intermediate level of English

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Feedzai is the world’s first RiskOps platform for financial risk management, and the market leader in safeguarding global commerce with today’s most advanced cloud-based risk management platform, powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence. Feedzai is securing the transition to a cashless world while enabling digital trust in every transaction and payment type. The world’s largest banks, processors, and retailers trust Feedzai to protect trillions of dollars and manage risk while improving the customer experience for everyday users, without compromising privacy. Feedzai is a Series D company and has raised $282M to date. With a valuation of +$1.5B, the company's technology protects 900 million people in 190 countries.

The Data Science Team within Customer Success is highly engaged with our clients making use of their critical thinking skills with a business-focused mentality and customer-facing attitude. They activate, maintain, and support clients, develop models and rules, and train & enable them. In addition, they work cross-functionally with other departments (e.g., Research, Product, Marketing) in a collaborative team spirit spanning the globe to ensure we deliver best in class risk prevention solutions. Being on the frontline of fighting crime and protecting people from financial harm is incredibly inspiring to each of us. Join Us!

Your Day To Day

  • Work with project teams to establish business questions and data requirements;
  • Work with risk consultants and data scientists to perform data mapping and data quality validation;
  • Design and write programs for data cleaning, extraction, segmentation, and statistical analysis on large population datasets using languages such as Python, SQL and Spark on cloud-based computing platforms;
  • Analyze and draw insights from fraud trends & market trends, and support industry wide analytical studies;
  • Design, implement, test and tune rules to capture fraudulent and suspicious activities;
  • Monitor risk strategy performance and deep dive on performance issue.

You Have & You Know-how

  • 4+ years of experience in a data analyst or related role;
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or in a related field;
  • Knowledge of scripting/programming for data analysis and ETL pipelines (e.g., Python, PySpark and SQL);
  • Knowledge of reporting & data visualization techniques;
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio);
  • Good verbal and written communication skills, suitable to working with internal and external partners;
  • Ability to communicate findings in a clear way to key stakeholders and devise action plans from those findings;
  • Experience working together with Data Science teams is a plus;
  • Experience in Financial Crime or Payments is highly value.

The Customer Success Team is responsible for delivering our product to our clients. This includes education, configuration, solution development, and risk strategy to enable our clients to address their pain points. We collaborate with our clients to ensure they have the right solution, build out a strategy and training plan for them, and then support them through each phase of our client lifecycle. We grow at a fast clip and believe no challenge is too big or too small. Therefore, we have an open environment that encourages us to lean in, try new things, and discover our potential. Join Us!

Your First 30-Days At Feedzai

You will be immersed in our brand with training, connections, and one-on-one time with your manager. You may shadow your colleagues virtually or onsite at an office depending on where you work as you are supported through your Feedzai journey. In addition, you will have access to a ton of information to give you history, context, and all the knowledge you can handle about Feedzai and the team. Finally, you will start working on projects and collaborating on work currently being done. We can't wait to have you join the team!

Life at Feedzai Instagram

Feedzai Culture

Feedzai is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Feedzai does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

Feedzai will use the personal data you provide us with by filling out this form for reviewing your application and to potentially negotiate a contract with you. Your personal data will be retained by Feedzai for 24 months following your application. Please see our Privacy Notice available at https://feedzai.com/about-us/privacy/ for more information on how we process your personal data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

AUTODOC company, the European e-commerce leader in sales of auto parts, is looking for a Data Analyst in the Supply Chain management department.

We are seeking a talented Supply Chain Management Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data analysis and an understanding of supply chain management processes. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing data, developing and maintaining performance metrics, and identifying areas for improvement in our supply chain management process. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to optimize the supply chain management process and ensure the timely delivery of goods.

To be successful in the position requires balancing excellent analytical skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Identify and interpret patterns, trends, and insights related to the supply chain management process.
Developing and maintaining supply chain performance metrics such as order total cycle time, inventory turnover, and delivery performance.
Data mining, data integration, and custom analytics for sc management.
Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations for development.
Estimate the potential impact of initiatives and changes to the supply chain. Supplier performance analytics and making recommendations for supplier selection
Develop automated and interactive dashboards/reports that support business stakeholders' needs and allow them to make decisions quickly.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams. You will work closely with other teams, such as warehouse management, procurement, and logistics, to optimize the supply chain management process and ensure the timely delivery of goods.
Partner with the Data Engineering team to define and build reliable data sources.



Requirements


3+ years of analytical experience in e-commerce, retail, or other relevant industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data and translate it into insights and recommendations.
Bachelor's degree in any related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel.
Proven experience designing and enhancing dashboards using BI tools.
Ability to work with large amounts of data and draw conclusions useful for business on their basis.
Experience turning complex data results into meaningful visualizations with clear insights
Good communication skills and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent English.



Soft skills


Good understanding of the business processes of the e-commerce company
Ability to find points of growth / possible areas of optimization in the company's work and formulate action plans for implementing changes
Mindset on an independent search for facts. Ability to deal with uncertainty in data. Ability to ask questions correctly and formulate clear answers to them
Readiness for continuous development, expansion of the range of professional skills, and automation of routine operations



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast-growing international company with stable employment
A cafeteria benefit system, thanks to which you can choose the option you will use - life insurance, private medical care, sports card, cinema tickets, and others
Transportation Services (for all the Warehouse employees)
Guaranteed 26 days of vacation per calendar year, regardless of seniority;
An extra day off so you can celebrate your birthday;
24/7 hotline and online sessionsMental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members via
AUTODOC Corporate Discount (1,080 Euros per annum) to order parts for their own use at special discounted rates
Opportunities for advancement, further training (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform), and coaching
Free language classes English,German and Polish
Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI - Lisboa
HTML:
Descrição da Empresa

A TIMING é uma Empresa de Trabalho Temporário e de Gestão de Recursos Humanos que está presente no mercado Ibérico, apresentando um conjunto de serviços que visam dar resposta às necessidades dos nossos parceiros através de soluções rápidas, produtivas e de baixo custo. A nossa equipa possui uma vasta experiência na Gestão de Recursos Humanos, e reúne técnicos especializados para as diferentes áreas que oferece ao mercado. Delegações em Portugal Delegações em Espanha - Albufeira - Faro - Barcelona - Lagos - Lisboa - Sevilha - Portimão - Quarteira - Tavira

Descrição da Função

Descrição de funções: A TIMING, Empresa de Trabalho Temporário e Gestão de Recursos Humanos, com delegações de Norte a Sul de Portugal, encontra-se a recrutar prestigiada empresa cliente na Lisboa: Funções:

  • De dependência direta do responsável do Departamento de TI, a pessoa selecionada terá como principias funções:
  • Contribuir e participar nas reuniões semanais do Dep. TI;
  • Gerir a infraestrutura de Azure e Azure SQL Database Server;
  • Manutenção e criação de Reporting em PowerBI;
  • E outras funções inerentes ao posto de trabalho. Perfil do candidato:
  • Boa capacidade de relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Apetência e gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Formação superior em Informática de Gestão, Engenharia Informática ou áreas similares;
  • Experiência anterior em funções similares;
  • Bom sentido critico e de análise de negócio;
  • Disponibilidade imediata. Será para trabalhar diretamente no cliente. Se preenche os requisitos, envie a sua candidatura ou ligue para o 911 193 743. Your time is now! Localização
  • LISBOA, Portugal

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Engineer (m/f)
Description:
Fox IT is a Portuguese IT Consulting Company, born in 2018 with a huge desire to make a positive difference in the IT Industry. Seeing the consultants as our biggest assets, our Mission is to promote fair trade between us, our consultants, and our clients.

We are looking for a Data Analyst/ Data Engineer to join our team.

Project: Design and Supervision of the Installation and Implementation of a Data Warehouse Solution with Supervisory Technology Capabilities

Requirements


Proficiency in conceptualizing and structuring analytics systems.
Ability to design scalable and efficient architectures for data processing and analysis.
Expertise in creating blueprints for data flow and integration within analytics platforms.
Proficiency in ETL processes and tools, particularly those within the Microsoft ecosystem
Strong understanding of data modeling principles and practices, especially in Microsoft environments.
Expertise in developing interactive dashboards, reports and KPIs for data visualization.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, including SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services), and SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services).
Availability for travel (fly-in and fly-out).
Fluent in both written and verbal communication (Portuguese as native language and proficiency level: B2 or C1).


Preferred Competencies


Experience with Azure data services like Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, PowerBI


Work Regime: Hybrid regime

What We Offer


25 days of vacation
health insurance
Training
Opportunity to develop your career


Take the Leap, Join Us!

Title: Data & Analytics Expert
Description:
Position Snapshot

Location: Lisbon/ Braga

Full-time/ Hybrid mode

About Us

Nestlé Business Services (NBS) is at the heart of the Nestlé Group. We provide Supply Chain, Financial, HR, Digital & social media, CRM and Consumer Engagement services to enable Nestlé to engage with millions of consumers worldwide. We are a multicultural and diverse team of professionals. We are passionate about digital innovation and driving continuous improvement of processes with colleagues across the world.

We are looking for talents who are eager to learn, team players, digitally-savvy, with an entrepreneurial mindset, and who can flourish in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

If this describes you, and you are looking to join a business where you can really add value, it is time to consider joining NBS!

Position Summary

The Data and Analytics Expert is an Above Market Point of Contact, supporting Digital Manager(s) to orchestrate & accelerate dashboard deployment, adoption of analytics use cases, documenting analytics successes and building capabilities. The Expert will look above market at valuable use cases, and drive analytics and insights from the data available to them from the tools. This job is a fantastic opportunity for the right person who is looking to manage Data & Analytics internationally.

A day in the life of...


Expert will support SBU/Zone Digital Manager(s) and Marketing Teams in defining strategy and use cases for analytics, and opportunities for data to drive decisions in the business.
Must provide high level analysis on trends, opportunities and answer burning business questions. Must build analytics capabilities in markets with hands on learning and use case adoption
Expert must work to ensure level one dashboards are deployed in markets and at business level and they adopt global solutions for efficiencies and to drive above market business analytics capabilities.
They are responsible for working with businesses to ensure priority markets meet all pre-requisites for global level two dashboards - i.e. adopting global media naming conventions and global tagging plans for websites. Expert must support businesses and markets with capabilities training when it comes to data KPIs, first party data value exchange and growth strategies, data governance best practice and delivering the global data capabilities training and courses.
Expert must use global guidance to help set KPIs and benchmark against external performance
Data & Analytics Expert must adopt global guidance on analytics service line best practice, and work with businesses and markets to define business use cases to be answered by the new service.


What Will Make You Successful


More than 5 years in digital marketing /eBusiness working with global brands.
Proven data analyst experience - taking data and analysing to provide measure campaign performance and providing KPI performance scoring
Past experience on feeding predictive models to contribute to journeys, someone that is used to look for Data to feed CRM programs
Experience in data boarding visualization and building: PowerBI, Adverity, Data Studio experience a plus.
Previous experience in marketing and campaign management. Agency or account management a plus. Proficient English writing, reading, speaking
Proven change management experience
Excellent communication skills
Team oriented mentality and attitude
Ownership, responsibility & adaptability
Result oriented


What We Offer

Here at NBS Lisbon/Braga we care about our Talents, and we continuously work to have our teams engaged and our people achieving their best professional performance, without forgetting personal development and work-life balance. Joining NBS Lisbon/ Braga will bring you:


Development of expertise in Nestlé’s Shared Services Business
Immersion in a culturally diverse team
Local and International Exposure
Flexible working environment
Engagement and wellbeing activities
Competitive salary and annual bonus according to your performance
Meal Allowance Card
Flex Benefits - At NBS you can chose what benefits are more suitable for you
Make part of the Nestlé Club and get discount in several partners
Free coffee (and good coffee) at the office.
Shop with special discounts for employees
Company equipment according to professional needs
Medical Support available at the Office
E-learning courses and training program to get you where you aim to be
Career progression and possibilities for International Career

Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Ready to Take the Field?


Fyld is a Portuguese consulting company specializing in IT services. We bring high-performance professionals into the field across a wide range of technological areas.

Inspired by sports management philosophy, we strive to achieve peak performance with each of our consultants. We focus on training and excellence.


Join us for the next game!


We are looking for our next PowerBI Consultant:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Relevant certifications in Power BI are advantageous, such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate;
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Power BI Consultant or in a similar role;
  • Proven track record of designing and implementing Power BI solutions for clients;
  •  In-depth knowledge of Power BI & DAX;
  • Proficiency in using Power BI Desktop for data visualization, dashboard creation, and report generation;
  • Experience in connecting Power BI to various data sources, including databases, Excel files, and cloud services;
  • Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and experience in building data models in Power BI;
  • Experience in data preparation and transformation using Power Query Editor within Power BI;
  • Ability to analyze data trends, patterns, and outliers to derive actionable insights for clients;
  • Experience in integrating Power BI with other Microsoft products and services, such as Azure, Dynamics 365, and Office 365;
  • Strong consulting skills and ability to engage with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into Power BI solutions;
  • Experience in managing Power BI projects, including scoping, planning, and delivery, within specified timelines and budgets;
  • Fluent in English.


We prioritize:

High standards, professionalism, and dedication; everything else can be learned.


If you're interested in joining our team, send your CV to: daniela.vito@fyld.pt


Fyld, where the top talents step into the spotlight.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (M/F)
HTML:
O Sport Lisboa e Benfica está a recrutar um Junior Data Engineer (M/F):


PRINCIPAL MISSÃO DA FUNÇÃO

Apoiar na definição, desenvolvimento e implementação de modelos de dados de suporte à decisão, solicitados pelas áreas de negócios Corporativas;

Planear e desenvolver Dashboards e Relatórios sobre os modelos implementados.

RESPONSABILIDADES CHAVE

✓ Projetar e manter estruturas de dados de relatórios para o desenvolvimento de dashboards e relatórios analíticos;

✓ Gerir pipelines de transformação de dados (ETL) sobre as estruturas de dados;

✓ Criação e manutenção de dashboards e relatórios;

✓ Suporte e manutenção quer dos pipelines quer dos dashboards e relatórios.

QUALIFICAÇÕES, EDUCAÇÃO E FORMAÇÃO EXIGIDAS

✓ Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Ciências Informáticas, Análise de Dados ou similar;

✓ Experiência em análise, desenvolvimento e implementação de modelos analíticos e reporting;

✓ Conhecimento de linguagens SQL e Python;

✓ Preferência pelas tecnologias: SQL Server, SAS Viya, Power BI e Microsoft Fabric;

✓ Conceitos e Melhores Práticas nas práticas de engenharia de dados e visualização de dados.

ATRIBUTOS PESSOAIS E APTIDÕES

✓ Comunicação;

✓ Análise de informação e sentido critico;

✓ Sigilo;

✓ Criatividade e inovação;

✓ Métodos de trabalho e organização;

✓ Rigor e atenção ao detalhe.

HTML:
Mission

Do you like to work with data and make sense out of it?

Check Out The Profile And Apply Now

Organização

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum's team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society.
